Topics covered:

* Alex has decided that NATO is invading “Russian-held areas in Ukraine” in an attempt to lure Russia into a war
* Alex wrongly claims that [https://web.archive.org/web/20111217151026/http://2001.ukrcensus.gov.ua/eng/results/general/nationality/ the Donbas region] is 98% Russian
* Russia’s [https://huri.harvard.edu/files/huri/files/idp_report_3_burkhardt_et_al.pdf?m=1642520438 strategy of passportization]
* Artur Pawlowski was [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/pawlowski-charges-bail-denied-coutts-protest-blockade-1.6354354 arrested] and [https://calgaryherald.com/news/crime/street-church-minister-to-remain-behind-bars-pending-trial-for-allegedly-inciting-border-blockade has been denied bail]
* 4 protesters at Coutts charged with [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/coutts-protest-charges-laid-court-appearance-bail-1.6352482 conspiracy to murder RCMP members]
* Bomb threats to a [https://o.canada.com/news/local-news/all-clear-given-after-bomb-threat-at-the-ottawa-hospital hospital in Ottawa], the [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/windsor/windsor-bomb-threat-arrest-1.6355526 mayor of Windsor], and [https://www.beaconjournal.com/story/news/2022/02/11/akron-area-man-calls-ottawa-ohio-make-bomb-threat-canada/6753322001/ Ottawa, Ohio]
* [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/tamara-lich-bail-hearing-february-19-1.6358307 Tamara Lich], [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/convoy-organizers-charged-bail-1.6357263 Chris Barber], and [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/king-charges-ottawa-police-convoy-1.6358079 Pat King] all arrested and charged
* The police chief in Ottawa [https://www.nytimes.com/live/2022/02/15/world/canada-protests-news Peter Sloly resigned]
* Tow truck companies were [https://www.newsweek.com/canadian-towing-company-ignore-trudeau-order-disrupt-trucker-protests-1679957 not necessarily in support of the protest], but [https://globalnews.ca/news/8625386/canada-convoy-blockades-towing-companies/ seemed to be afraid to aid police] because of the possibility of reprisals from the protesters
* Making accusations of ethnic cleansing of Russians has been a consistent pattern of Putin (and Medvedev) prior to invasions in [https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSLC605039 2008], [https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/vladimir-putin-says-russia-will-not-allow-ethnic-cleansing-in-ukraine-1.2837324 2014], and now it’s happening in the present
* In relation to both [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/jan/21/russia-human-rights-violation-georgia-war-echr-ruling the 2008 war with Georgia] and the [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/05/20/opinion/russia-is-trying-to-wipe-out-crimeas-tatars.html 2014 annexation of Crimea], there are very serious concerns that Russian forces actually were engaging in ethnic cleansing
* Biden said that he was [https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/speeches-remarks/2022/02/18/remarks-by-president-biden-providing-an-update-on-russia-and-ukraine-2/ not going to send troops into Ukraine], but would support Ukraine and impose sanctions
* Chrystia Freeland’s grandfather was the editor of [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/freeland-knew-her-grandfather-was-editor-of-nazi-newspaper/article34236881/ a publication that printed anti-Semitic content] based in Poland in WWII
* David Icke isn’t crying, but he could be
* The [https://howbad.info/index.html How Bad Is My Batch website] is absurd

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss the stretch of time where Alex responds to Trump finally seeming to come to his social media defense, and the protests in response to the killing of George Floyd begins.

Topics covered include:

  • Alex reports on a report from the Freedom Foundation about a few Covid-19 deaths being gunshot victims. This report itself is a misrepresentation of a Washington Department of Health press briefing, and this foundation is an anti-union think tank funded by right-wing billionaires.

  • Alex complains that a murder victim was listed in the New York Times list of Covid-19 deaths, failing to recognize that they released a correction and fixed their error before the release of the late edition of the paper.

  • Alex claims that 80% of Covid-19 deaths are people over 85. This is not true.

  • The CDC’s report on excess deaths in New York City.

  • Alex misrepresents Michigan governor Gretchen Whitmer’s April executive order about nursing homes creating dedicated units to treat Covid-19 patients.

  • Alex gets very anti-Islam about a few mosques being allowed to broadcast their call to prayer during Ramadan in London. Alex pretends that anyone trying to broadcast some kind of Christianity would be shut down, which means he’s never heard of Chicago’s “State Street Preacher.”

  • Alex is mad that some UK politicians are fasting in solidarity with Muslims during Ramadan, but he completely missed the story where one of them accidentally tweeted out a picture of bacon to celebrate the beginning of the fast.

  • Alex discusses Trump’s antagonism toward mail-in voting. The reality is that many states already use mail-in voting primarily, we have a well-established absentee voting process, and Trump’s spokesperson has used it in every election since 2008.

  • The Brennan Center for Justice has cited rates of fraud related to mail-in voting as being lower than rates of in-person voting fraud.

  • Alex complains that NY Health Department deleted something from their website. A spokesperson explained that they just updated the guidance from the original declaration.

  • Alex discusses a Robert Kennedy Jr. article about two Bill Gates-linked vaccine trials. Two of the primary sources cited in this article seem to not match the content of the article, which is super suspicious.

  • Alex appears to have admitted to being a lobbyist, and if he isn’t lying, he may have committed a crime if he didn’t report these expenses.

  • Alex begins to build a number of very racist narratives about the murder of George Floyd. Dan and Jordan discuss the ways he does so by comparing his use of language surrounding this event, as compared to instances where a non-white person kills a white person. It’s like night and day.
citations_mediawiki:
Dan and Jordan discuss the stretch of time where Alex responds to Trump finally seeming to come to his social media defense, and the protests in response to the killing of George Floyd begins.

Topics covered include:

* Alex reports on [https://www.freedomfoundation.com/washington/washington-health-officials-gunshot-victims-counted-as-covid-19-deaths/ a report from the Freedom Foundation] about a few Covid-19 deaths being gunshot victims. This report itself is a misrepresentation of [https://www.freedomfoundation.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/DOH-COVID-19-telebriefing.mp3 a Washington Department of Health press briefing], and this foundation is an anti-union think tank [https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/Freedom_Foundation funded by right-wing billionaires].
* Alex complains that a murder victim was listed in the New York Times list of Covid-19 deaths, failing to recognize that [https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2020/may/24/new-york-times-lists-homicide-victim-coronavirus-d/ they released a correction] and fixed their error before the release of the late edition of the paper.
* Alex claims that 80% of Covid-19 deaths are people over 85. [https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/nvss/vsrr/covid_weekly/index.htm This is not true].
* [https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/69/wr/mm6919e5.htm The CDC’s report] on excess deaths in New York City.
* Alex misrepresents [https://www.mlive.com/public-interest/2020/04/whitmer-orders-nursing-homes-to-transfer-coronavirus-patients-to-separate-units-or-special-facilities.html Michigan governor Gretchen Whitmer’s April executive order] about [https://content.govdelivery.com/attachments/MIEOG/2020/04/15/file_attachments/1428213/EO%202020-50%20Emerg%20order%20-%20long-term%20care%20facilities.pdf nursing homes creating dedicated units] to treat Covid-19 patients.
* Alex gets very anti-Islam about [https://metro.co.uk/2020/05/05/call-prayer-broadcast-first-time-london-borough-lockdown-ramadan-12658639/ a few mosques being allowed to broadcast their call to prayer during Ramadan in London]. Alex pretends that anyone trying to broadcast some kind of Christianity would be shut down, which means he’s never heard of [https://www.dnainfo.com/chicago/20160314/downtown/state-street-preacher-emblem-of-free-speech-chicago-after-trump-rally/ Chicago’s “State Street Preacher.]”
* Alex is mad that some UK politicians are fasting in solidarity with Muslims during Ramadan, but he completely missed the story where [https://metro.co.uk/2020/04/27/lib-dem-tweets-picture-bacon-solidarity-muslims-fasting-ramadan-12616236/ one of them accidentally tweeted out a picture of bacon] to celebrate the beginning of the fast.
* Alex discusses Trump’s antagonism toward mail-in voting. The reality is that [https://www.ncsl.org/research/elections-and-campaigns/all-mail-elections.aspx many states already use mail-in voting primarily], we have a well-established absentee voting process, and [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/kayleigh-mcenany-vote-by-mail-record-comments-absentee/ Trump’s spokesperson has used it in every election since 2008].
* The Brennan Center for Justice has cited [https://www.brennancenter.org/our-work/analysis-opinion/false-narrative-vote-mail-fraud rates of fraud related to mail-in voting] as being lower than [https://www.brennancenter.org/our-work/research-reports/debunking-voter-fraud-myth rates of in-person voting fraud].
* Alex complains that NY Health Department deleted something from their website. [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8360381/New-York-Health-Department-website-deletes-order-stating-nursing-homes-shouldnt-deny-admissions.html A spokesperson explained] that they just updated the guidance from the original declaration.
* Alex discusses [https://www.organicconsumers.org/news/another-gates-vaccine-bites-dust a Robert Kennedy Jr. article] about two Bill Gates-linked vaccine trials. [https://investors.modernatx.com/news-releases/news-release-details/moderna-announces-positive-interim-phase-1-data-its-mrna-vaccine Two of the primary sources] [https://www.immunology.ox.ac.uk/covid-19/covid-19-immunology-literature-reviews/chadox1-ncov-19-vaccination-prevents-sars-cov-2-pneumonia-in-rhesus-macaques cited in this article] seem to not match the content of the article, which is super suspicious.
* Alex appears to have admitted to being a lobbyist, and if he isn’t lying, [https://smallbusiness.chron.com/federal-lobbying-guidelines-14110.html he may have committed a crime] if he didn’t report these expenses.
* Alex begins to build a number of very racist narratives about the murder of George Floyd. Dan and Jordan discuss the ways he does so by comparing his use of language surrounding this event, as compared to instances where a non-white person kills a white person. It’s like night and day.

Topics covered:

* A [https://freerepublic.com/focus/f-news/928604/posts family in Waltham], MA, doesn’t like standardized tests
* Alex gets some of the details wrong about [http://www.thedentlawfirm.com/officer-inquiry.html a story] involving a [http://www.theppsc.org/Archives/Firearms-Safety/ArlingtonTX-Cops.htm cop being shot] in a training exercise
* Alex gets some of the details wrong about a story involving a [https://www.chron.com/news/houston-texas/article/Lubbock-police-Man-charged-in-shooting-of-2014240.php cop being shot] at a stand-off in Lubbock
* Alex uses [https://web.archive.org/web/20050605084707/http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Middle_East/EE09Ak01.html an op-ed] to prove that Leo Strauss is connected to neocons
* Alex uses [http://home.alphalink.com.au/~radnat/austindependence/neo-cons.html an op-ed] to prove that neocons have been proven to be communists
* Alex sensationalizes a story about [https://web.archive.org/web/20030727235719/http://www.baynews9.com/NewsStory.cfm?storyid=19674 an officer’s gun discharging] at a training exercise at a Florida school

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex makes very insistent predictions that Biden will declare martial law lockdowns on August 11. If this doesn’t happen or happens on another date, Alex believes that he’s still correct in his reporting because him covering the idea of martial law being declared on the 11th is what made martial law not be declared on the 11th.

  • Alex uses an upcoming Emergency Alert System test to reinforce his predictions about August 11.

  • Alex’s new benefactor Mike Lindell is running an absurd Cyber Symposium Aug. 10-12

  • DHS has warned of increased online threats of violence surrounding election conspiracies

  • Bild editor-in-chief apologized for Covid coverage back in May

  • “Donald Trump Will Live In Shame”

  • 1982 letter of introduction for Bild founder to the Director of the CIA

  • Alex is endorsing Karen Kingston’s Covid vaccine conspiracies, which are dumb

  • Some people do still get the bubonic plague

  • The media did cover the recent CO death related to the plague

  • South Lake Tahoe was closed over concerns about plague-infected chipmunks

  • Alex warns that NY is going to roll out vaccine passports, but he’s just misreporting a story about the Excelsior Pass, which NY introduced in March, and is entirely voluntary

  • Alex interviews Ivory Hecker, the local Houston Fox reporter who quit on air, revealing that she was going to spill the beans to Project Veritas

  • Ivory may have not been censored by CPAC, nor by Fox Nation

  • The TX Secretary of State has reviewed Dominion election software three times, in 2012 and two times in 2019. Each time, various concerns were raised, and Texas decided not to use their system.

  • The Election Assistance Commission, as well as the states of Pennsylvania and Washington have also reviewed the same software and found it to be satisfactory

  • Alex’s Orwell quote is not an actual Orwell quote
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Alex makes very insistent predictions that Biden will declare martial law lockdowns on August 11. If this doesn’t happen or happens on another date, Alex believes that he’s still correct in his reporting because him covering the idea of martial law being declared on the 11th is what made martial law not be declared on the 11th.
* Alex uses [https://www.fema.gov/press-release/20210611/fema-and-fcc-plan-nationwide-emergency-alert-test-aug-11-test-messages-will an upcoming Emergency Alert System test] to reinforce his predictions about August 11.
* Alex’s new benefactor Mike Lindell is running [https://www.dakotanewsnow.com/2021/07/23/mike-lindell-says-his-sioux-falls-cyber-symposium-will-prove-election-fraud-experts-have-doubts/ an absurd Cyber Symposium] Aug. 10-12
* DHS has [https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/06/politics/homeland-security-warning-political-conspiracy-threat-violence/index.html warned of increased online threats] of violence surrounding election conspiracies
* Bild editor-in-chief [https://de.rt.com/inland/121789-bild-chef-entschuldigt-sich-fur/ apologized for Covid coverage] back in May
* “[https://www.bild.de/politik/kolumnen/kolumne/kommentar-von-bild-chef-julian-reichelt-donald-trump-wird-in-schande-leben-74784700.bild.html Donald Trump Will Live In Shame]”
* [https://www.cia.gov/readingroom/docs/CIA-RDP83M00914R002800050073-1.pdf 1982 letter of introduction] for Bild founder to the Director of the CIA
* Alex is endorsing Karen Kingston’s Covid vaccine conspiracies, [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/graphene-oxide-mrna-vaccines/ which are dumb]
* Some people [https://www.cdc.gov/plague/maps/index.html do still get the bubonic plague]
* The media [https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/24/us/colorado-plague-10-year-old-death/index.html did cover the recent CO death] related to the plague
* [https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/aug/03/lake-tahoe-chipmunks-bubonic-plague South Lake Tahoe was closed] over concerns about plague-infected chipmunks
* Alex warns that NY is going to roll out vaccine passports, but he’s just misreporting a story about the Excelsior Pass, which NY introduced in March, and [https://www.governor.ny.gov/news/governor-cuomo-announces-launch-excelsior-pass-help-fast-track-reopening-businesses-and is entirely voluntary]
* Alex interviews [https://www.thedailybeast.com/local-fox-reporter-ivory-hecker-suspended-for-live-on-air-project-veritas-stunt Ivory Hecker], the local Houston Fox reporter who quit on air, revealing that she was going to spill the beans to Project Veritas
* Ivory may have not been censored by CPAC, [https://www.thedailybeast.com/cpac-attendees-turn-on-conference-sponsorfox-news nor by Fox Nation]
* The TX Secretary of State has reviewed Dominion election software [https://www.sos.texas.gov/elections/laws/dominion.shtml three times], in 2012 and two times in [https://www.sos.texas.gov/elections/forms/sysexam/oct2019-watson.pdf 2019]. Each time, various concerns were raised, and Texas decided not to use their system.
* The [https://www.eac.gov/voting-equipment/democracy-suite-55-modification Election Assistance Commission], as well as the states of [https://www.votespa.com/About-Elections/Pages/Dominion-Democracy-Suite-55A.aspx Pennsylvania] and [https://www.sos.wa.gov/_assets/elections/research/democracy-suite-5.5-report.pdf Washington] have also reviewed the same software and found it to be satisfactory
* Alex’s Orwell quote [https://quoteinvestigator.com/2013/02/24/truth-revolutionary/ is not an actual Orwell quote]

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex spends a lot of time talking about clips from Bill Maher’s show and a recent CNN interview with Brett Favre

  • Alex misrepresents issues related to proposed Covid vaccine boosters

  • Alex cherry-picks a month old article about Covid vaccine efficacy

  • Alex claims that most people deliver children by C-section. This is not true.

  • Alex claims that most people do not breastfeed. This is not true.

  • Regeneron themselves admit that there were some side-effects recorded in their trials

  • FL Gov. DeSantis has some suspicious financial ties to a hedge fund with heavy investment in Regeneron

  • Regeneron was awarded a $450 million contract to produce their cocktail, and reached an agreement to sell the federal government all their product for over $2 billion

  • Alex claims that “the Globalists” eat “vats of poop.” This is just not medically possible

  • Alex fearmongers about news about Israel’s green passports

  • Alex defends himself against accusations that he called Trump a dumbass by explaining that he was trying to imply that Trump is an evil traitor

  • Sean Brooks does not understand the Indiana University lawsuit, which was rejected to be heard by the Supreme Court

  • Sean Brooks seems like a person who has undisclosed reasons for his opposition to public education, like his history of disciplinary violations from back when he was a teacher (h/t Heavy)

  • The Brody Stevens Interview Challenge holds up

* Alex spends a lot of time talking about clips from Bill Maher’s show and a recent CNN interview with Brett Favre

* Alex claims that “the Globalists” eat “vats of poop.” This is just not medically possible
* Alex fearmongers about [https://www.jpost.com/israel-news/everything-you-need-to-know-about-israels-green-passport-program-659437 news about Israel’s green passports]

* Sean Brooks does not understand [https://www.insidehighered.com/sites/default/server_files/media/indiana_lawsuit.pdf the Indiana University lawsuit], which was [https://www.supremecourt.gov/search.aspx?filename=%2Fdocket%2Fdocketfiles%2Fhtml%2Fpublic%2F21a15.html rejected] to be heard by the Supreme Court
* Sean Brooks seems like a person who has undisclosed reasons for his opposition to public education, like [https://data.tallahassee.com/troubled-teachers/charlotte/brooks-sean-mccalla/15-0142-RT/ his history of disciplinary violations] from back when he was a teacher (h/t [https://heavy.com/news/dr-sean-brooks-phd-oxford-ohio-video/ Heavy])
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=68Sz3PH3FLE The Brody Stevens Interview Challenge] holds up

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex is very excited about the Canadian trucker convoy

  • There aren’t a million truckers in Canada

  • Numbers of participants have varied depending on who you ask, but it’s definitely lower than Alex thinks

  • Canada Trucking Association released a statement denouncing and discouraging the convoy

  • Ipsos poll finds that the Canadian public is not opposed to public health measures

  • The convoy was organized by Tamara Lich, the secretary of the Western secessionist Maverick Party. The party’s leader Jay Hill has been using the convoy as a means to attack Trudeau

  • There are some suspicions about the money coming in to the convoy’s GoFundMe

  • Canada Unity is essentially calling for an overthrow of the Canadian government

  • Maine/New Brunswick border crossing blocked

  • CBC article about the restrictions truckers are already under, including a DOT physical

  • Full video of the minute long clip of Klaus Schwab talking about the Young Global Leaders program

  • Mike Crispi has no chance in the primary

  • Jackson Lehmeyer is running a religious vaccine exemption con

  • The news about the Pennsylvania court’s decision about mail-in ballots is not as meaningful as folks like Roger may be making it

  • The new version of the Ashli Babbitt killing is just based on a Zero Hedge post, and it’s not true
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Alex is very excited about the Canadian trucker convoy
* There [https://www.statista.com/statistics/947317/canadian-trucking-industry-total-drivers/ aren’t a million truckers] in Canada
* Numbers of participants [https://www.baytoday.ca/business/trucker-convoy-continues-east-to-winnipeg-after-making-overnight-stop-near-regina-4991652 have varied] depending on [https://ottawa.ctvnews.ca/truck-convoy-rolls-into-kingston-ont-1.5756220 who you ask], but it’s definitely lower than Alex thinks
* Canada Trucking Association [http://cantruck.ca/canadian-trucking-alliance-statement-to-those-engaged-in-road-border-protests/ released a statement] denouncing and discouraging the convoy
* [https://globalnews.ca/news/8532791/covid-unvaccinated-restrictions-tax-poll/ Ipsos poll] finds that the Canadian public is not opposed to public health measures
* The convoy was organized by Tamara Lich, the secretary of the Western secessionist Maverick Party. The party’s leader Jay Hill has been using the convoy as [https://westernstandardonline.com/2022/01/maverick-party-says-it-supports-truckers-right-to-protest-peacefully/ a means to attack Trudeau]
* There are [https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/vaccine-protest-convoy-gofundme-donations-1.6330594 some suspicions] about the money coming in to the convoy’s GoFundMe
* Canada Unity is [https://canada-unity.com/mou/ essentially calling for an overthrow of the Canadian government]
* [https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2022/01/29/small-group-of-protesters-set-up-blockade-at-houlton-woodstock-border-crossing-in-belleville.html Maine/New Brunswick border] crossing blocked

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/b22d23f8-1d98-4532-922c-d0633f67bcd7/SoupKitchen.JPG|thumb|none]]

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1ab73cd3-6aff-4546-8b96-48f246f57500/SoupKitchen2.JPG|thumb|none]]

* [https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatoon/truck-convoy-vaccination-freedoms-1.6330176 CBC article] about the restrictions truckers are already under, including a [https://www.solvhealth.com/health-a-z/dot-physical DOT physical]
* [https://iop.harvard.edu/forum/strengthening-collaboration-fractured-world-featuring-special-guest-yo-yo-ma Full video] of the minute long clip of Klaus Schwab talking about [https://www.younggloballeaders.org/vision-and-mission the Young Global Leaders program]
* Mike Crispi has [https://ballotpedia.org/Mike_Crispi no chance in the primary]
* Jackson Lehmeyer is running [https://www.washingtonpost.com/religion/2021/09/15/pastor-donate-vaccine-religious-exemption/?pml=1&request-id=1cb4393c-dd8a-4891-8117-b911a1e163b5 a religious vaccine exemption con]
* The news about the [https://apnews.com/article/pennsylvania-voting-donald-trump-tom-wolf-31b4e7d0b16a996c63079c8aa3c3b121 Pennsylvania court’s decision] about mail-in ballots is not as meaningful as folks like Roger may be making it
* The new version of the Ashli Babbitt killing is just [https://www.zerohedge.com/political/stop-no-dont-babbitt-tried-stop-attack-capitol-speakers-lobby-video-analysis-suggests based on a Zero Hedge post], and [https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2022/jan/21/youtube-videos/ashli-babbitt-vs-antifa-video-falsely-claims-babbi/ it’s not true]

  • In homage to the shields of the Spartans, the letter lambda has become strongly associated with the military, including being present in many military fraternities and sorority names

citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* In homage to the shields of the Spartans, the letter lambda has become strongly associated with the military, including being present in many military [http://militaryfraternity.com/become-a-lambda-man/ fraternities] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lambda_Beta_Alpha sorority] names
* [https://www.worldhistory.org/Sacred_Band_of_Thebes/ The Sacred Band of Thebes]
* Alex’s friend Mike Hansen is running for constable and funding the run by operating a firework stand
* Alex does not understand the League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
* Stuart Gerstacker’s is not a story of the CPS stealing children, it was an [https://web.archive.org/web/20160415180307/http://kidnappedson.blogspot.com/ ugly divorce], and he was clearly an unwell person, as evidenced by this [https://www2.traviscountytx.gov/commissioners_court/agendas/2007/07/text/vs070703_01.asp Commissioners Court transcript]
* The bill that would have made the Secretary of Homeland Security eighth in the line of succession [https://www.congress.gov/bill/108th-congress/senate-bill/148 passed the Senate] but [https://www.congress.gov/bill/108th-congress/house-bill/2319?r=65&s=1 did not pass in the House]
* Secretary of Homeland Security was made [https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/3/19 #18 in the line of succession] in 2006
* Alex misrepresents [https://www.c-span.org/video/?167674-1%2Fanti-terrorism-policy-review John Ashcroft’s comment]s before the Senate Committee on the Judiciary
* This Thomas Paine quote is from a text called [https://www.bartleby.com/184/112.html Thoughts on Defensive War], and [https://books.google.com/books/about/New_Directions_in_Thomas_Paine_Studies.html?id=5BYtnQAACAAJ scholars are not in agreement] that it was actually Paine who wrote it
* An example of [https://itistreason.wordpress.com/category/obama/ the conspiracy theorist usage] of Catherine Bertini’s words about using food as leverage
* Text of the report from the [https://authoring.prod.unwomen.org/sites/default/files/Headquarters/Attachments/Sections/CSW/PFA_E_Final_WEB.pdf 1995 World Conference on Women]
* [https://www.un.org/esa/gopher-data/conf/fwcw/conf/una/950906150325.txt Full context of Bertini’s comments]

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss Millie Weaver’s new documentary, which some people are pretending are involved in her recent arrest.

Topics covered include:

  • Millie Weaver and her husband Gavin Wince were arrested on August 14, on felony charges of burglary, tampering with evidence, obstruction of justice, and domestic violence.

  • Millie claims that government contractors are not subject to FOIA requests. This is not true. You can find all sorts of information about government contractors on the FOIA portal.

  • One of Millie’s experts, Patrick Bergy alleges to be the first 40 year old private in the US military. He also ran for Pasco County Election Supervisor, which did not result in a victory. After the campaign, Bergy didn’t pay a fine when told to by the commission, and eventually negotiated a settlement.

  • Patrick Bergy’s story largely relies on appeals to stories about IIA, or Interactive Internet Activity. The primary source about this is a 2007 memo which discusses public relations guidelines for interactive internet engagement of DoD personnel in certain foreign countries. It does not appear to be anything close to what they claim.

  • Patrick Bergy wrote a book called Victim Of The Swamp.

  • Millie says that upstream collection of data is a large part of what the NSA does, but this is not accurate. A 2011 report found that 9% of internet data collected was upstream collection, as opposed to stuff acquired directly from ISPs. Also, the NSA reported that they amended their upstream collection practices in April 2017.

  • The 2008 passport data breach involved contractors from Stanley Inc and The Analysis Group. It did not involve CGI, although CGI did acquire Stanley in 2010, two years later.

  • The Analysis Corporation is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Global Strategies Group.

  • Millie thinks that CGI stands for Canadian Global Information, because those words are in the first line of their Wikipedia page. The name actually stands for Conseillers en Gestion et Informatique.

  • The John Brennan quid-pro-quo theory does not make sense, given that he was a high level Obama advisor prior to the passport breach, and was clearly on a short-list to be in the administration.

  • The PRISM program did not involve upstream collections of data.

  • Dynology has received many government contracts over the years. One of these contracts involves work that was performed in Germany, which Millie is claiming involves the Congressional Knowledge Management Service. This is based on her seeing the acronym “CMKS” on the contract, which she took to mean Congressional Knowledge Management Service, although the acronym for that should be CKMS. In cloud computing, CMKS is an abbreviation for Customer Master Keys, so it is entirely possible that this is what this contract was for, and there’s no evidence provided that it has anything to do with the Congressional Knowledge Management Service.

  • Patrick Bergy asserts that the Smith-Mundt Modernization Act of 2012 made it legal for the US government to propagandize the US population. This is a misunderstanding that apparently began with a sloppy column in Buzzfeed, which took on a life of its own. The Smith-Mundt Act of 2012 only made it so programs created by the Broadcasting Board of Governors could be accessible in the US, primarily because with the internet as it is, there’s basically no way to stop it, and because these programs may be the preferred news sources of diaspora communities in the US. The Act itself explicitly lays out that money allocated to these organizations cannot be used to sway public opinion in the US.

  • Patrick Bergy seems to think that every recent instance of non-white communities expressing dissatisfaction with things like police violence are examples of people being swayed by Department of Defense IIA operations. The documentary doesn’t include instances of white identity protests being accused of being IIA, which is weird.

  • Patrick Bergy’s story seems to include a whole lot of instances of him being rebuffed by prominent people, like Matt Gaetz and Dan Bongino, after he approaches them about ShadowNet. The fact that they won’t sign onto his conspiracy theory seems to consistently be taken as evidence that they themselves are involved in the ShadowNet conspiracy.

  • Millie’s other expert, Tore, was also Millie’s primary source for her “reporting” about questions surrounding the 2019 election in Kentucky.

  • Tore’s full name is Terpsichore Lindeman, and her claims about voter roll discrepancy were debunked by ProPublica.

  • Tore was investigated by the North Dakota attorney general for inappropriately soliciting charitable donations in 2018. She also decided to run for mayor of Minot, North Dakota on a platform of Make Minot Great Again. She did not make it to the ballot. Fellow citizens started a Change.org petition to stop her from running for mayor.

  • In 2011, Tore is listed as an undergraduate student in biology at the University of Kentucky, in the program for their Showcase of Undergraduate Scholars.

  • However, according to her own Medium page, she claims that she was in medical school in 2008. In Millie’s documentary, she also claims that she was working on secret projects for John Brennan in 2008, which seems like a problem. Her page on TogetherWeServed also claims to have been attending the University of Kentucky in 2008.

  • Tore’s Medium page was largely about issues related to foreign language interpreting and serving immigrant communities, until August 2016, when the tone completely changed and it became a very intense conspiracy, pro-Trump blog. Even as her writing shifted into being about the evil forces conspiring about Trump, she did not claim to have first-hand knowledge of these evil forces, which she does claim now, which seems weird.

  • Robert Storch was re-nominated by Trump in June 2017. In December, he was confirmed by the Senate as the Inspector General of the NSA. Millie says that it “appears he was never actually confirmed,” which makes no sense.

  • Paul Manafort was not the only Trump campaign connection to Psy-Group.

  • Shawn Lucas was in a video serving papers to the DNC, but he was just employed as a process server. It was not his lawsuit. Though tragic, the claim that his death was suspicious or a murder has not been substantiated at all.

  • Trump did not make it so people lose their security clearances when they leave their jobs. Because of how clearances work, this would be a logistical and administrative nightmare and create so much more bureaucracy.

  • Millie read the first paragraph of an Interpol report about robotics and law enforcement and reported on it. She neglects to mention any of the relevant content of the report.

  • Millie found a 2017 patent for employee surveillance technology owned by Dynology. She presents this outside of the workplace context, and misrepresents the patent. She also fails to point out this is just an updating of an existing 2015 patent.
citations_mediawiki:
Dan and Jordan discuss Millie Weaver’s new documentary, which some people are pretending are involved in her recent arrest.

Topics covered include:

* Millie Weaver and her husband Gavin Wince [https://heavy.com/news/2020/08/millie-weaver/ were arrested on August 14], on felony charges of burglary, tampering with evidence, obstruction of justice, and domestic violence.
* Millie claims that government contractors are not subject to FOIA requests. [https://washingtontechnology.com/articles/2017/02/17/insights-proxmire-foia-advice.aspx This is not true]. You can find all sorts of information about government contractors on [https://foiaonline.gov/foiaonline/action/public/home the FOIA portal].
* One of Millie’s experts, Patrick Bergy alleges to be [https://www.tampabay.com/archive/2005/10/27/bound-for-boot-camp-he-s-booted-from-his-job/ the first 40 year old private in the US military]. He also ran for [https://www.tampabay.com/archive/2004/10/11/independent-candidate-strives-to-be-heard/ Pasco County Election Supervisor], which [https://www.pascovotes.gov/portals/pasco/Results/gen04all.htm did not result in a victory]. After the campaign, Bergy [http://www.fec.state.fl.us/FECWebFi.nsf/0/EB6EA80B40C7CA6485257C2F00735CDA/$file/158.pdf didn’t pay a fine] when told to by the commission, and eventually [http://www.fec.state.fl.us/FECWebFi.nsf/0/7C014BB7366B7E6785257C0E00587C5B/$file/206.pdf negotiated a settlement].
* Patrick Bergy’s story largely relies on appeals to stories about IIA, or Interactive Internet Activity. The primary source about this is [https://fas.org/sgp/othergov/dod/dod060807.pdf a 2007 memo] which discusses public relations guidelines for interactive internet engagement of DoD personnel in certain foreign countries. It does not appear to be anything close to what they claim.
* Patrick Bergy wrote a book called [https://www.amazon.com/Victim-Swamp-State-Destroyed-Private/dp/1977646468 Victim Of The Swamp].

* Millie says that upstream collection of data is a large part of what the NSA does, but this is not accurate. A 2011 report found that [https://www.aclu.org/files/assets/fisc_opinion_10.3.2011.pdf 9% of internet data collected] was upstream collection, as opposed to stuff acquired directly from ISPs. Also, the NSA reported that they [https://www.nsa.gov/news-features/press-room/Article/1618699/nsa-stops-certain-section-702-upstream-activities/ amended their upstream collection practices] in April 2017.
* The [https://www.nytimes.com/2008/03/22/us/politics/22passport.html 2008 passport data breach] involved contractors from [https://web.archive.org/web/20080324040415/http://deepbackground.msnbc.msn.com/archive/2008/03/21/794799.aspx Stanley Inc and The Analysis Group]. It did not involve CGI, although [https://washingtontechnology.com/articles/2010/05/07/cgi-buys-stanley.aspx CGI did acquire Stanley in 2010], two years later.
* The Analysis Corporation is a [https://www.sourcewatch.org/index.php/The_Analysis_Corporation wholly-owned subsidiary of Global Strategies Group].
* Millie thinks that CGI stands for Canadian Global Information, because those words are in the first line of their Wikipedia page. The name actually stands for [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2013/10/16/meet-cgi-federal-the-company-behind-the-botched-launch-of-healthcare-gov/ Conseillers en Gestion et Informatique].
* The John Brennan quid-pro-quo theory does not make sense, given that [https://web.archive.org/web/20110507023129/http://www.northjersey.com/news/120509_North_Bergen_man_is_homeland_security_assistant_for_President_Obama.html he was a high level Obama advisor prior to the passport breach], and was clearly on a short-list to be in the administration.
* The PRISM program did not involve upstream collections of data.
* Dynology has received [https://www.usaspending.gov/#/search/b174b27784aef45c8a6b0640ee63792c many government contracts] over the years. [https://www.usaspending.gov/#/award/CONT_AWD_W912PE08P7083_9700_-NONE-_-NONE- One of these contracts] involves work that was performed in Germany, which Millie is claiming involves the Congressional Knowledge Management Service. This is based on her seeing the acronym “CMKS” on the contract, which she took to mean Congressional Knowledge Management Service, although the acronym for that should be CKMS. In cloud computing, CMKS is an abbreviation for Customer Master Keys, so it is entirely possible that this is what this contract was for, and there’s no evidence provided that it has anything to do with the Congressional Knowledge Management Service.
* Patrick Bergy asserts that the Smith-Mundt Modernization Act of 2012 made it legal for the US government to propagandize the US population. This is [https://foreignpolicy.com/2013/07/14/u-s-repeals-propaganda-ban-spreads-government-made-news-to-americans/ a misunderstanding that apparently began with a sloppy column in Buzzfeed], which took on a life of its own. The Smith-Mundt Act of 2012 only made it so programs created by the Broadcasting Board of Governors could be accessible in the US, primarily because with the internet as it is, there’s basically no way to stop it, and because these programs may be the preferred news sources of diaspora communities in the US. The Act itself explicitly lays out that [https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/BILLS-112hr5736ih/pdf/BILLS-112hr5736ih.pdf money allocated to these organizations cannot be used to sway public opinion in the US].
* Patrick Bergy seems to think that every recent instance of non-white communities expressing dissatisfaction with things like police violence are examples of people being swayed by Department of Defense IIA operations. The documentary doesn’t include instances of white identity protests being accused of being IIA, which is weird.
* Patrick Bergy’s story seems to [https://www.victimoftheswamp.com/2020/02/22/the-witness-obamas-shadownet/ include a whole lot of instances] of him being rebuffed by prominent people, like Matt Gaetz and Dan Bongino, after he approaches them about ShadowNet. The fact that they won’t sign onto his conspiracy theory seems to consistently be taken as evidence that they themselves are involved in the ShadowNet conspiracy.
* Millie’s other expert, Tore, [https://www.infowars.com/breaking-new-evidence-confirms-kentucky-election-fraud/ was also Millie’s primary source] for her “reporting” about questions surrounding the 2019 election in Kentucky.
* Tore’s [https://www.propublica.org/article/misinformation-efforts-over-kentucky-vote-could-be-playbook-for-2020 full name is Terpsichore Lindeman], and her claims about voter roll discrepancy were debunked by ProPublica.
* Tore was [https://attorneygeneral.nd.gov/news/attorney-general-details-investigation-unlicensed-business-alleged-fraud-tore-maras-lindeman investigated by the North Dakota attorney general] for inappropriately soliciting charitable donations in 2018. She also decided to [https://www.kfyrtv.com/content/news/Second-candidate-running-in-Minot-mayoral-race-468072953.html run for mayor of Minot, North Dakota] on a platform of Make Minot Great Again. [https://www.minotdailynews.com/news/local-news/2018/06/election-results-upheld-in-official-tally/ She did not make it to the ballot]. Fellow citizens started [https://www.change.org/p/concerned-citizens-of-minot-prohibit-tore-maras-lindeman-from-running-for-mayor-in-minot-nd a Change.org petition] to stop her from running for mayor.
* In 2011, Tore is listed as an undergraduate student in biology at the University of Kentucky, in the [https://www.uky.edu/chellgren/sites/www.uky.edu.chellgren/files/FINAL%20ABSTRACT%20BOOK.pdf program for their Showcase of Undergraduate Scholars].
* However, [https://medium.com/immigration-policy/usa-language-confidential-8aec1c253d96 according to her own Medium page], she claims that she was in medical school in 2008. In Millie’s documentary, she also claims that she was working on secret projects for John Brennan in 2008, which seems like a problem. [https://navy.togetherweserved.com/usn/servlet/tws.webapp.WebApp?ID=506419&cmd=ShadowBoxProfile&type=Person Her page on TogetherWeServed] also claims to have been attending the University of Kentucky in 2008.
* [https://medium.com/@drlindeman Tore’s Medium page] was largely about issues related to foreign language interpreting and serving immigrant communities, until August 2016, when the tone completely changed and it became a very intense conspiracy, pro-Trump blog. Even as her writing shifted into being about the evil forces conspiring about Trump, she did not claim to have first-hand knowledge of these evil forces, which she does claim now, which seems weird.
* Robert Storch was [https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/president-donald-j-trump-announces-key-additions-administration-2/ re-nominated by Trump in June 2017]. In December, [https://www.nsa.gov/news-features/press-room/Article/1618765/robert-storch-confirmed-as-national-security-agency-inspector-general/ he was confirmed by the Senate] as the Inspector General of the NSA. Millie says that it “appears he was never actually confirmed,” which makes no sense.
* Paul Manafort was not the only [https://www.thedailybeast.com/rick-gates-tells-mueller-about-trump-teams-dealings-with-israeli-intelligence-firm Trump campaign connection to Psy-Group].
* Shawn Lucas was in a video serving papers to the DNC, but he was [https://heavy.com/news/2016/11/shawn-lucas-cause-of-death-drugs-released-kratom-fentanyl-dnc-process-server-democratic-national-committee-hillary-clinton-conspiracy-theory-theories-seth-rich/ just employed as a process server]. It was not his lawsuit. Though tragic, the claim that his death was suspicious or a murder has not been substantiated at all.
* Trump did not make it so people lose their security clearances when they leave their jobs. Because of [https://clearedjobs.net/security-clearance-faqs how clearances work], this would be a logistical and administrative nightmare and create so much more bureaucracy.
* Millie read the first paragraph of [https://www.europarl.europa.eu/cmsdata/196207/UNICRI%20-%20Artificial%20intelligence%20and%20robotics%20for%20law%20enforcement.pdf an Interpol report] about robotics and law enforcement and reported on it. She neglects to mention any of the relevant content of the report.
* Millie found a [https://patents.justia.com/patent/20170061345 2017 patent] for employee surveillance technology owned by Dynology. She presents this outside of the workplace context, and misrepresents the patent. She also fails to point out this is just an updating of an existing 2015 patent.

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Social Sentinel did not capture threats in advance about Uvalde

  • Angeli Gomez rushed in to get her kids out of the school, but there is no evidence that police officers did that

  • At the time of this episode, there would have been reason for Alex to think Ramos was outside the school for 12 minutes before the shooting, though that timeline is incorrect

  • A retired federal agent may have communicated with the Buffalo shooter on racist websites

  • Ted Nugent restricted guns at his concert, and his upcoming dates are at venues that prohibit customers bringing in any weapons

  • Durham failed in his case against Sussmann

  • Uvalde police chief stopped cooperating with investigation
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Social Sentinel [https://www.vox.com/recode/23150863/school-surveillance-mass-shooting-texas-uvalde did not capture threats] in advance about Uvalde
* Angeli Gomez [https://www.ksat.com/news/local/2022/06/05/uvalde-mother-who-ran-into-school-describes-being-handcuffed-saving-kids-during-shooting-im-going-in-there/ rushed in to get her kids] out of the school, but [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/officers-rescued-own-children-texas/ there is no evidence] that police officers did that
* At the time of this episode, [https://www.wsj.com/articles/uvalde-residents-voice-frustration-over-shooting-response-11653588161 there would have been reason] for Alex to think Ramos was outside the school for 12 minutes before the shooting, though [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/05/27/uvalde-texas-school-shooting-timeline/ that timeline is incorrect]
* A retired federal agent [https://www.salon.com/2022/05/27/buffalo-shooter-may-have-shared-plans-with-retired-agent-before-massacre-report_partner/ may have communicated] with the Buffalo shooter on racist websites
* Ted Nugent [https://www.wsls.com/news/2018/07/19/pro-gun-rocker-ted-nugent-turns-away-firearms-from-his-roanoke-show/ restricted guns at his concert], and his [https://www.rutheckerdhall.com/audience-safety-prohibited-items upcoming] [https://floridatheatre.com/venue-info/faq dates] are at venues that prohibit customers bringing in any weapons
* [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/05/31/us/politics/michael-sussmann-durham-fbi.html Durham failed] in his case against Sussmann
* Uvalde police chief [https://www.salon.com/2022/06/01/another-uvalde-claim-falls-apart--now-police-chief-refuses-to-cooperate-with-investigation/ stopped cooperating with investigation]

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex gets on board the “vaccine gives people AIDS” (or “VAIDS”) train

  • He says that more heterosexuals are being diagnosed with HIV, but that is just a misreading of a recent Guardian article

  • The Moderna research into an mRNA HIV vaccine has been in the works for over a year now. They just launched their phase 1 human trials

  • A new variant of HIV was identified in the Netherlands, but all the details Alex describes about the story are made up

  • Alex misrepresents George Soros’s comments about Ukraine from a 2014 interview with Fareed Zakaria

  • Alex and Roger Stone misreport the contents of the Durham filing

  • NYT article about Durham filing. Washington Post article about Durham filing

  • Alex’s previous guest about the Ottawa convoy, Jeremy Mackenzie, is also the de facto leader of a neo-fascist group that wants to create a new country called Diagolon. He also was recently arrested on gun charges, and a piece of body armor recently seized by Canadian police at the protests in Coutts had a Diagolon patch on it

  • Alex interviews a guy named Dr. Marble who has nothing but bad ideas

  • An insurance CEO did say that deaths were way up since the pandemic began, but he did not say that these are not Covid-deaths

Topics covered:

* Alex gets on board the “vaccine gives people AIDS” (or “VAIDS”) train
* He says that more heterosexuals are being diagnosed with HIV, but that is just a misreading of [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/feb/09/hiv-infects-heterosexual-gay-bisexual-men-uk-testing-virus a recent Guardian article]
* The Moderna research into an mRNA HIV vaccine has been in the works for over a year now. They just launched their [https://www.healthline.com/health-news/moderna-launches-clinical-trial-of-its-mrna-based-hiv-vaccine phase 1 human trials]
* A new variant of HIV was [https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.abk1688 identified in the Netherlands], but all the details Alex describes about the story are made up
* Alex misrepresents [https://transcripts.cnn.com/show/fzgps/date/2014-05-25/segment/01 George Soros’s comments] about Ukraine from a 2014 interview with Fareed Zakaria
* Alex and Roger Stone misreport the contents of the [https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.dcd.235638/gov.uscourts.dcd.235638.35.0_1.pdf Durham filing]
* [https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/14/us/politics/durham-sussmann-trump-russia.html NYT article] about Durham filing. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/02/15/heres-why-trump-once-again-is-claiming-spying-by-democrats/ Washington Post article] about Durham filing
* Alex’s previous guest about the Ottawa convoy, [https://pressprogress.ca/meet-the-extremists-and-social-media-influencers-at-the-centre-of-the-far-right-siege-of-ottawa/ Jeremy Mackenzie], is also [https://www.antihate.ca/holocaust_denier_travelling_canada_building_up_far_right_militia_diagolon_alex_vriend the de facto leader of a neo-fascist group] that wants to create a new country called Diagolon. He also was recently arrested on gun charges, and a piece of body armor recently seized by Canadian police at the protests in Coutts [https://globalnews.ca/news/8621125/canadian-anti-hate-network-concerned-diagolon-coutts-border-protest-diagolon/ had a Diagolon patch on it]
* Alex interviews a guy named Dr. Marble who has nothing but bad ideas
* An insurance CEO [https://thehill.com/changing-america/well-being/longevity/588738-huge-huge-numbers-death-rates-up-40-percent-over-pre did say that deaths were way up] since the pandemic began, but he did not say that these are not Covid-deaths

citations_title: Episode 446: The Super Alpha Male Championship
citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss Owen Shroyer’s attempt at a fun WWE-style push up contest.

Topics covered include:

  • Owen doesn’t realize that he’s using a tag team belt for an individual competition, which makes no sense. The current holders of that belt are The New Day, who are one of the most important black groups in WWE history.

  • Dan discusses how Owen’s attempt at cutting a wrestling promo about the contest is a failure, by juxtaposing it with two classic promos.

  • Alex bum-rushes Owen’s show to try to steal the belt, which leads to a fake fight, and ultimately Owen pretending to murder Alex by strangulation. Alex is clearly very impaired, and it’s embarrassing all around.

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss a very word-heavy episode of The Alex Jones Show.

Topics covered include:

  • A study about hydroxychloroquine has been retracted by Lancet. Alex misrepresents this retraction, and seems to be arguing that the original study was an attack on Trump. The reality is that multiple studies have come out recently that indicate that hydroxychloroquine is not an effective treatment for Covid-19.

  • There was another study retracted by the New England Journal of Medicine, which Alex thinks was also about hydroxychloroquine, but it was actually about blood pressure medications. Alex does not understand how these retractions came to happen, and how it all traces back to a company called Surgisphere, whose owner may or may not be shady.

  • New York Post story about Ian Haydon, who retweeted a Moderna press release about the Covid-19 vaccine entering phase 2.

  • Alex talks about the World Economic Forum’s Great Reset idea. This is an op-ed on their website as well as a gigantic information visualization. Alex is making up stuff about both.

  • Alex pretends that the current protesters want to kill cops, when in reality they are mostly arguing in favor of defunding and disbanding police departments. Conversely, Alex himself has frequently threatened the lives of literally all police in the country if they enforce hypothetical future gun regulations.

  • Alex tries to explain why he has a chess board, a skull, and a rose on his desk. He is unsuccessful.

  • Alex arbitrarily decides to announce that Bill Gates was running Epstein’s entire operation, and thus accuses him, with no evidence, of engaging in rampant child abuse and making snuff films. He’s lucky his targets are too busy to sue him.

  • Alex plays Project Veritas’s new video which pretends to expose antifa. This video is a complete load of shit, and most likely is a total fraud.

  • Without evidence, Alex reports that George Floyd’s death is being listed as a Covid-19 death. It is true that Floyd did test positive for Covid-19, but if you review the guidelines that the state of Minnesota released in April about how to fill out death certificates, it seems incredibly unlikely that he would be listed as a Covid-19 death.

  • Alex claims that the police in Melbourne are mostly minorities, but that does not appear to be true. Melbourne is a part of Victoria, and analyses from 1979 and 2008 both show police departments that are definitely not mostly minorities. Beyond that, there is not compelling evidence that police officers of color are less likely to police in racially biased ways.

  • Alex has no idea what happened regarding National Guard troops in Washington DC. The mayor did not evict troops, just refused to pay for their lodging.

  • Alex claims that Lego has pulled sets including cops from the shelves. This is not true, and is just a dumb propaganda narrative that was pushed by Trump’s campaign staff, and failed congressional candidate Deanna Lorraine.

  • Alex has learned how to pronounce the name Bolsonaro.

  • Alex wants to outlaw “liberalism,” which he seems to think means democrats, which it does not.

  • Alex reads the Wikipedia page for Ochlocracy, thinking he’s reading the definition of Oligarchy. He doesn’t know what any of these words mean, and is just pulling things out of his ass.

  • A caller from Northern Ireland thinks that Trump’s election was prophesied by the Illuminati Card Game. This is very silly.

  • A caller explains to Alex that his skull, chess board and rose could be easily interpreted as an occult altar, based on her experience as a former occult follower. Alex explains he was just trying to get attention.
citations_mediawiki:
Dan and Jordan discuss a very word-heavy episode of The Alex Jones Show.

Topics covered include:

* A study about hydroxychloroquine has been [https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/04/lancet-retracts-major-covid-19-paper-that-raised-safety-concerns-about-malaria-drugs/ retracted by Lancet]. Alex misrepresents this retraction, and seems to be arguing that the original study was an attack on Trump. The reality is that [https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/03/hydroxychloroquine-does-not-prevent-covid-19-infection-in-people-who-have-been-exposed-study-says/ multiple] [https://www.statnews.com/2020/06/05/hydroxychloroquine-had-no-benefit-for-hospitalized-covid-19-patients-possibly-closing-door-to-use-of-drug/ studies] have come out recently that indicate that hydroxychloroquine is not an effective treatment for Covid-19.
* There was another [https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa2007621 study retracted by the New England Journal of Medicine], which Alex thinks was also about hydroxychloroquine, but it was actually about blood pressure medications. Alex does not understand [https://www.theguardian.com/science/2020/may/28/questions-raised-over-hydroxychloroquine-study-which-caused-who-to-halt-trials-for-covid-19 how these retractions came to happen], and how it all traces back to a company called Surgisphere, whose owner [https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/peteraldhous/image-manipulation-surgisphere-sapan-desai may or may not be shady].
* [https://nypost.com/2020/05/27/moderna-coronavirus-vaccine-tester-fainted-had-high-fever/ New York Post story] about Ian Haydon, who retweeted [https://investors.modernatx.com/news-releases/news-release-details/moderna-announces-first-participants-each-age-cohort-dosed-phase a Moderna press release] about the Covid-19 vaccine entering phase 2.
* Alex talks about the World Economic Forum’s Great Reset idea. This is [https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2020/06/now-is-the-time-for-a-great-reset/ an op-ed] on their website as well as [https://intelligence.weforum.org/topics/a1G0X000006OLciUAG?tab=publications a gigantic information visualization]. Alex is making up stuff about both.
* Alex pretends that the current protesters want to kill cops, when in reality they are mostly arguing in favor of defunding and disbanding police departments. Conversely, Alex himself has frequently threatened the lives of literally all police in the country if they enforce hypothetical future gun regulations.
* Alex tries to explain why he has a chess board, a skull, and a rose on his desk. He is unsuccessful.
* Alex arbitrarily decides to announce that Bill Gates was running Epstein’s entire operation, and thus accuses him, with no evidence, of engaging in rampant child abuse and making snuff films. He’s lucky his targets are too busy to sue him.
* Alex plays Project Veritas’s new video which pretends to expose antifa. This video [https://www.thedailybeast.com/project-veritas-uses-bookstore-from-portlandia-as-nefarious-antifa-hq is a complete load of shit], and most likely is a total fraud.
* Without evidence, Alex reports that George Floyd’s death is being listed as a Covid-19 death. It is true that [https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/04/health/george-floyd-coronavirus-autopsy/index.html Floyd did test positive for Covid-19], but if you review [https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data/nvss/vsrg/vsrg03-508.pdf the guidelines that the state of Minnesota released in April] about how to fill out death certificates, it seems incredibly unlikely that he would be listed as a Covid-19 death.
* Alex claims that the police in Melbourne are mostly minorities, but that does not appear to be true. Melbourne is a part of Victoria, and analyses from [http://johnbraithwaite.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/Note%20on%20the%20Demographic%20Composition%20of%20Australian%20Police%20Forces%20and%20Prisons%20Services.pdf 1979] and [https://researchbank.swinburne.edu.au/file/cbac5752-a103-44b8-acda-1bd155166f30/1/PDF%20%28Published%20version%29.pdf 2008] both show police departments that are definitely not mostly minorities. Beyond that, [http://www.policeaccountability.org.au/racial-profiling/will-a-more-diverse-police-force-reduce-racial-profiling/ there is not compelling evidence] that police officers of color are less likely to police in racially biased ways.
* Alex has no idea what happened regarding [https://ksltv.com/438915/utah-national-guardsmen-evicted-from-dc-hotels/ National Guard troops in Washington DC]. The mayor did not evict troops, [https://www.wusa9.com/article/news/verify/verify-no-dc-mayor-bowser-did-not-evict-national-guard-members-from-a-marriott-hotel/65-202afda1-1b47-4101-a4d2-7a9a0be6b7ed just refused to pay for their lodging].
* Alex claims that Lego has pulled sets including cops from the shelves. [https://factcheck.thedispatch.com/p/did-lego-pull-products-featuring This is not true], and is just a dumb propaganda narrative that was pushed by Trump’s campaign staff, and failed congressional candidate Deanna Lorraine.
* Alex has learned how to pronounce the name Bolsonaro.
* Alex wants to outlaw “liberalism,” which he seems to think means democrats, which it does not.
* Alex reads the Wikipedia page for Ochlocracy, thinking he’s reading the definition of Oligarchy. He doesn’t know what any of these words mean, and is just pulling things out of his ass.
* A caller from Northern Ireland thinks that Trump’s election was prophesied by the Illuminati Card Game. This is very silly.
* A caller explains to Alex that his skull, chess board and rose could be easily interpreted as an occult altar, based on her experience as a former occult follower. Alex explains he was just trying to get attention.

Topics covered:

  • In the present day, a man attacked a vaccination clinic

  • Paul Joseph Watson is on to talk about his new book

  • Paul would later admit that David Icke woke him up, not Alex

  • Alex’s own book was published by Progressive Press, which also published the writing of noted anti-Semite Henry Makow

  • There were Alzheimer’s and nicotine vaccines in development in 2003, but no one was suggesting that they be made mandatory

  • Decisions about what vaccines are mandatory are made on the state level

  • Antony Sutton’s writing is not well respected

  • Kozlov did go to Bohemian Grove in 1959, and it was widely reported by outlets like the New York Times

  • Article complaining about community policing

  • The 45 goals of communism that was read into the congressional record was just from W. Cleon Skousen’s book The Naked Communist

  • Alex is incorrect about Gloria Steinem’s CIA connection
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* In the present day, a man [https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/2022/01/05/california-vaccination-clinic-attack-apollo/ attacked a vaccination clinic]
* Paul Joseph Watson is on to talk about [https://1library.net/document/zlgkrory-order-chaos-elite-terrorism-new-world-order-pdf.html his new book]
* Paul would later admit that [https://www.thedailybeast.com/alex-jones-protege-paul-joseph-watson-is-about-to-steal-his-crackpot-crown David Icke woke him up], not Alex
* Alex’s own book was published by [https://web.archive.org/web/20210805222143/http://www.progressivepress.com/ Progressive Press], which also published the writing of [https://www.savethemales.ca/000612.html?_ga=2.177904877.99370410.1641412520-36664201.1641412520 noted anti-Semite Henry Makow]
* There were [https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/politics/2003/05/22/dropped-alzheimers-drug-reversed-disease-in-some/ae32bdc0-1809-4380-8c8b-28fc665563d8/ Alzheimer’s] and [https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18352843/ nicotine vaccines] in development in 2003, but no one was suggesting that they be made mandatory
* Decisions about what vaccines are mandatory are [https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/parents/records/schools.html made on the state level]
* Antony Sutton’s writing is [https://www.proquest.com/openview/692fb9148a320b350392a54dc2a68f87/1?cbl=1819744&pq-origsite=gscholar not well respected]
* Kozlov did go to Bohemian Grove in 1959, and it was widely reported by outlets like [https://www.nytimes.com/1959/07/06/archives/kozlov-is-feted-at-coast-resort-is-guest-at-bohemian-grove-in-area.html the New York Times]
* [http://www.channelingreality.com/documents/communist_oriented_policing.pdf Article complaining about community policing]
* The 45 goals of communism that was read into the congressional record was just [https://cultureshield.com/PDF/45_Goals.pdf from W. Cleon Skousen’s book The Naked Communist]
* Alex is incorrect about [https://allthatsinteresting.com/gloria-steinem Gloria Steinem’s CIA connection]

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss the end of last week on the Alex Jones Show.

Topics covered include:

  • Joe Rogan completely contradicts Alex’s narratives about his move to Spotify on a new episode of his podcast, featuring David Pakman.

  • Owen Shroyer jokingly declares that his next rally has a goal of spreading the virus to as many people as possible. This joke is not funny now, and will be less so when we hear about the first cases that trace back to the rally.

  • Alex appears to not know the difference between the Constitution and the Declaration of Independence. He also seems to think the amendments are the beginning of the Constitution.

  • There are some pastors that are in favor of the stay-at-home orders, like Rev. Piel.

  • Churches are a particularly dangerous location for transmission, and there have been cases of spread tracing back to churches, and a pastor who denied stay-at-home orders has died from Covid-19.

  • Alex did not make up the story about a church being burned.

  • Alex tries to use a tape of Ahmaud Arbury from 2017 to make it seem like his being killed is less of an injustice. It is disgraceful.

  • The man who beat up an elderly man at a hospital suffered from mental illness and has been charged with a crime.

  • A new study about hydroxychloroquine appears to indicate a higher death rate of people who have taken the medication opposed to people who have not.

  • There is no law that says animal trials are required for medical testing.
citations_mediawiki:
Dan and Jordan discuss the end of last week on the Alex Jones Show.

Topics covered include:

* Joe Rogan completely contradicts Alex’s narratives about his move to Spotify on a new episode of his podcast, featuring David Pakman.
* Owen Shroyer jokingly declares that his next rally has a goal of spreading the virus to as many people as possible. This joke is not funny now, and will be less so when we hear about the first cases that trace back to the rally.
* Alex appears to not know the difference between the [https://constitutionus.com/ Constitution] and the [https://www.archives.gov/founding-docs/declaration-transcript Declaration of Independence]. He also seems to think the amendments are the beginning of the Constitution.
* There are some pastors that are in favor of the stay-at-home orders, [https://www.baltimoresun.com/maryland/carroll/lifestyles/cc-rl-piel-050920-20200509-rzvmvq7uizfcnbwj2bz7cvgg5i-story.html like Rev. Piel].
* Churches are a particularly dangerous location for transmission, and there have been [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/apr/03/california-church-coronvirus-outbreak-sacramento cases of spread tracing back to churches,] and [https://nypost.com/2020/04/13/virginia-pastor-who-held-packed-church-service-dies-of-coronavirus/ a pastor who denied stay-at-home orders has died from Covid-19].
* Alex did not make up the [https://www.insider.com/mississippi-church-violated-coronavirus-orders-burnt-down-2020-5 story about a church being burned].
* Alex tries to use [https://time.com/5838863/ahmaud-arbery-police-tase-video/ a tape of Ahmaud Arbury from 2017] to make it seem like his being killed is less of an injustice. It is disgraceful.
* The man who beat up an elderly man at a hospital [https://www.foxnews.com/us/patient-beat-elderly-man-suffers-mental-issues suffered from mental illness] and [https://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/local/detroit-city/2020/05/24/man-20-faces-charges-beating-75-year-old-nursing-home-roommate/5252345002/ has been charged with a crime].
* [https://www.theguardian.com/science/2020/may/22/hydroxychloroquine-trumps-covid-19-cure-increases-deaths-global-study-finds A new study about hydroxychloroquine] appears to indicate a higher death rate of people who have taken the medication opposed to people who have not.
* There is [https://www.statnews.com/2020/03/11/researchers-rush-to-start-moderna-coronavirus-vaccine-trial-without-usual-animal-testing/ no law that says animal trials are required] for medical testing.

  • The Pfizer CEO clip that Renz is trying to pass off as a recent announcement is an out-of-context clip from 2018

Topics covered:

* Alex whiffs on the meanings of both “[https://www.ancestry.com/name-origin?surname=salvador salvador]” and “[https://www.ancestry.com/name-origin?surname=ramos ramos]”
* Alex correctly reports out [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/05/24/uvalde-texas-school-shooting/ many of the details of the Uvalde shooting], though the details that were available early on have been somewhat unreliable
* Alex speaks with a caller who alleges they are a special education teacher who worked with the shooter, though there is [https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2022/05/25/uvalde-texas-school-shooting-gunman/ no concrete confirmation] he was in special education classes
* [https://nces.ed.gov/programs/digest/d18/tables/dt18_233.70.asp Statistics on schools with armed security]
* [https://www.edworkingpapers.com/sites/default/files/ai21-476.pdf Study on the effects of having armed School Resource Officers at schools]
* [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aWtY3xX1CqQ The Jeep in Aurora was speeding up] with seeming disregard that people were in the way
* [https://www.9news.com/article/news/crime/sam-young-sentenced-225-protest-shooting/73-58fb3028-e090-4ca1-8c8e-399f307ad574 Article about the protester] who shot at the Jeep
* [https://www.washingtonpost.com/investigations/2021/09/20/vaccine-lawsuits-thomas-renz-covid/ Profile of Thomas Renz], who is not an experienced lawyer
* The Pfizer CEO clip that Renz is trying to pass off as a recent announcement is [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2022/01/12/fact-check-video-pfizer-ceo-microchip-pill-2018/9155684002/ an out-of-context clip from 2018]
* The current [https://www.bbc.com/news/health-61580089 Monkeypox has been traced] to the West African strain

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Fox Nation is the sort of streaming platform that employs Mark Fuhrman, who has said a bunch of racist shit in the past, and bragged about torturing people

  • Fox Nation announced new exclusive content from Tucker Carlson in February, and saw a considerable spike in subscriber counts

  • The co-writer of this documentary’s previous work includes directing multiple right-wing propaganda films

  • Center for Strategic and International Studies analysis of domestic terrorism events

  • Darren Beattie left the Trump administration after it was revealed that he was associated with the HL Mencken Club, a supposedly intellectual group of white nationalists

  • Early inaccurate reporting about the death of Officer Sicknick was not made up out of thin air, it was based on a press release from the Capital Police Department and two anonymous sources within law enforcement

  • Sicknick’s brother has confirmed that he was pepper-sprayed multiple times on January 6 and passed out requiring CPR

  • A little historical background on Ali Alexander

  • Tucker Carlson said all sorts of horrific shit in radio appearances between 2006-2009

  • 4 people were stabbed and 33 were arrested at a Washington Stop the Steal rally

  • 1 person was arrested for assault at an Idaho Stop the Steal rally

  • A man was arrested for tearing a woman’s mask off at a Pensacola Stop the Steal rally

  • 4 people were arrested at a Salem Stop the Steal rally

  • Stop the Steal did not have a permit to have an event on January 6. Ali and associates had managed to get a permit for a stealth event called One Nation Under God, which was for a small area on the capital grounds, specifically for 50 attendees or less

  • The Multanomah DA’s office maintains a dashboard of protest related arrests

  • There are plenty of examples of left-wing protesters who got arrested and charged with crimes. They didn’t all get away with everything, as folks in the right-wing media pretend

  • Analysis of the actual cases finds that there is not a trend of left-wing protesters getting away with protest related crime

  • Elijah Schaffer was inside the capitol on Jan. 6 and referred to the rioters as “revolutionaries” that day. Much like everyone else in the right-wing media sphere, his tone has changed since then and now it was a false flag pulled off with agent provocateurs

  • The Center for Security Policy is considered an extremist group by the SPLC

  • CSP founder Frank Gaffney Jr was a very hawkish voice regarding the Iraq war, and has written articles supporting the Patriot Act on many occasions

  • The CSP is an intensely Islamophobic organization, and have promoted the idea of Civilization Jihad, which argues that Muslim immigration to the US is a stealth aspect of attempting to take over the country. This is just outright bigotry

  • J. Michael Waller claimed that he saw people that he felt were provocateurs on January 6, but there is no evidence to back up his impressions, and the case he makes is not very compelling. It’s entirely possible that he saw people acting like they were in the military because 1 out 5 people arrested on Jan. 6 had served in the military

  • J Michael Waller participated as a talking head in Lauren Southern’s film Crossfire, arguing that Anifa events are orchestrated by agent provocateurs, which indicates that he had come to this conclusion prior to the events of January 6, and as such, his impartiality about his experience is an open question

  • Taylor Hansen is not a journalist, he’s an anti-abortion activist who recorded himself burning a Black Lives Matter flag on the evening of January 5

  • Details of the investigation into the Gov. Whitmer kidnapping plot do not support the argument that it was a plot manufactured by informants

  • Tucker has the number of people arrested in relation to the kidnapping plot wrong, because his reporting is just based on a misunderstanding of a misleading headline from the Gateway Pundit

  • The FBI didn’t “quietly” or “suspiciously” transfer Steven D’Antuono from the Detroit field office to the DC field office. They put out a press release about it
