Topics covered:

* Fox Nation is the sort of streaming platform that [https://nation.foxnews.com/the-fuhrman-diaries/ employs Mark Fuhrman], who has said a bunch of [https://www.bustle.com/articles/150320-transcripts-of-the-fuhrman-tapes-excerpts-show-why-they-were-such-a-blow-to-the-states racist shit] in the past, and [https://www.tampabay.com/archive/1995/08/19/fuhrman-tells-of-torture-on-tape-transcript/ bragged about torturing people]
* Fox Nation [https://press.foxnews.com/2021/02/fox-nation-to-launch-new-exclusive-content-with-tucker-carlson announced new exclusive content] from Tucker Carlson in February, and saw a [https://variety.com/vip/whats-fueling-fox-nation-subscriber-growth-per-mobile-data-1234970267/ considerable spike] in subscriber counts
* The co-writer of this documentary’s previous work includes [https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1692070/ directing multiple right-wing propaganda films]
* Center for Strategic and International Studies [https://www.csis.org/analysis/escalating-terrorism-problem-united-states analysis of domestic terrorism] events
* Darren Beattie [https://www.nydailynews.com/news/ny-pol-white-house-white-nationalist-darren-beattie-trump-20180819-story.html left the Trump administration] after it was revealed that he was associated with the [https://www.splcenter.org/hatewatch/2016/11/04/white-nationalists-gather-baltimore-ninth-annual-hl-mencken-club-conference HL Mencken Club], a supposedly intellectual [https://www.villagevoice.com/2013/07/10/is-the-h-l-mencken-club-an-extremist-hate-group-or-just-a-bunch-of-weary-old-white-guys/ group of white nationalists]
* Early inaccurate reporting about the death of Officer Sicknick was not made up out of thin air, it was based on a press release from [https://www.uscp.gov/media-center/press-releases/loss-uscp-colleague-brian-d-sicknick the Capital Police Department] and two anonymous sources within law enforcement
* [https://www.propublica.org/article/officer-brian-sicknick-capitol Sicknick’s brother has confirmed] that he was pepper-sprayed multiple times on January 6 and passed out requiring CPR
* A little [https://web.archive.org/web/20160210201318/http://www.digitaljournal.com/article/330847 historical background] on Ali Alexander
* Tucker Carlson [https://www.mediamatters.org/tucker-carlson/unearthed-audio-shows-tucker-carlson-using-white-nationalist-rhetoric-and-making said all sorts of horrific shit in radio appearances] between 2006-2009
* 4 people were stabbed and 33 were arrested at a [https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/12/us/stop-the-steal-protest-washington-dc-trnd/index.html Washington Stop the Steal rally]
* 1 person was arrested for assault at an [https://www.idahopress.com/eyeonboise/trump-supporters-hold-stop-the-steal-rally-isp-reports-one-arrest-for-assault/article_c181258b-8682-5a27-a3f9-528030c811b0.html Idaho Stop the Steal rally]
* A man was arrested for tearing a woman’s mask off at a [https://fox17.com/news/nation-world/man-arrested-video-shows-him-ripping-off-protestors-mask-florida-trump-rally Pensacola Stop the Steal rally]
* 4 people were arrested at a [https://www.kptv.com/news/stop-the-steal-rally-held-in-salem/article_ced8d6ac-21fd-11eb-9b78-ef86fc22e810.html Salem Stop the Steal rally]
* Stop the Steal did not have a permit to have an event on January 6. Ali and associates had managed to get [https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/21059849/leopold-capitol-police-protest-permits-january-6-common-law-release.pdf a permit for a stealth event called One Nation Under God], which was for a [https://www.uscp.gov/sites/uscapitolpolice.house.gov/files/wysiwyg_uploaded/U.S.%20Capitol%20Grounds%20Demonstration%20Area%20Map.pdf small area on the capital grounds], specifically for 50 attendees or less
* The Multanomah DA’s office maintains a [https://www.mcda.us/index.php/protest-cases dashboard of protest related arrests]
* There are [https://www.koin.com/news/protests/portland-rioter-gets-4-years-for-arson-assault/#:~:text=PORTLAND%2C%20Ore.,riot%20of%20September%2023%2C%202020. plenty] of [https://www.justice.gov/usao-or/pr/portland-man-sentenced-federal-prison-arson-during-protest-multnomah-county-justice examples] of left-wing [https://www.oregonlive.com/crime/2021/06/portland-man-who-pleaded-guilty-to-setting-fire-near-police-precinct-gets-5-years-in-prison.html protesters] who got arrested and charged with crimes. They didn’t all get away with everything, as folks in the right-wing media pretend
* [https://apnews.com/article/records-rebut-claims-jan-6-rioters-55adf4d46aff57b91af2fdd3345dace8 Analysis of the actual cases] finds that there is not a trend of left-wing protesters getting away with protest related crime
* Elijah Schaffer was inside the capitol on Jan. 6 and [https://mashable.com/article/elijah-schaffer-youtube-demonetization referred to the rioters as “revolutionaries”] that day. Much like everyone else in the right-wing media sphere, his tone has changed since then and now it was a false flag pulled off with agent provocateurs
* The Center for Security Policy is considered [https://www.splcenter.org/fighting-hate/extremist-files/group/center-security-policy an extremist group] by the SPLC
* CSP founder Frank Gaffney Jr was a very hawkish voice regarding the Iraq war, and has [https://jewishworldreview.com/cols/gaffney121305.asp written articles] [https://centerforsecuritypolicy.org/too-little-surveillance-2/ supporting the Patriot Act] on many occasions
* The CSP is an intensely Islamophobic organization, and have promoted the idea of [https://wayback.archive-it.org/3097/20180228192240/https://www.centerforsecuritypolicy.org/civilization-jihad-reader-series/ Civilization Jihad], which argues that Muslim immigration to the US is a stealth aspect of attempting to take over the country. This is just outright bigotry
* J. Michael Waller claimed that he saw people that he felt were provocateurs on January 6, but there is no evidence to back up his impressions, and [https://thefederalist.com/2021/01/14/i-saw-provocateurs-at-the-capitol-riot-on-jan-6/ the case he makes] is not very compelling. It’s entirely possible that he saw people acting like they were in the military because [https://www.npr.org/2021/01/21/958915267/nearly-one-in-five-defendants-in-capitol-riot-cases-served-in-the-military 1 out 5 people arrested on Jan. 6 had served in the military]
* J Michael Waller participated as a talking head in [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13736456/?ref_=nm_flmg_wr_1 Lauren Southern’s film Crossfire], arguing that Anifa events are orchestrated by agent provocateurs, which indicates that he had come to this conclusion prior to the events of January 6, and as such, his impartiality about his experience is an open question
* Taylor Hansen is not a journalist, he’s [https://www.yahoo.com/now/anti-abortion-terrorism-fueled-maga-220042430.html an anti-abortion activist] who recorded himself burning a Black Lives Matter flag on the evening of January 5

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1636344419035-J1HM2V8NXTSSP7V3KFGD/Hansen.JPG|thumb|none|alt=Image of Taylor used in Tucker’s documentary to illustrate his assault in Utah|Image of Taylor used in Tucker’s documentary to illustrate his assault in Utah]]

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/1636344441793-C7KVQNX5O520NC3GGE30/Hansen2.JPG|thumb|none|alt=Image of Taylor from a [https://www.christianpost.com/news/baby-lives-matter-activist-beaten-bloodied-by-antifa-rioters-in-portland.html Sept. 2020 article on Christian Post] about an assault that happened in Portland|Image of Taylor from a [https://www.christianpost.com/news/baby-lives-matter-activist-beaten-bloodied-by-antifa-rioters-in-portland.html Sept. 2020 article on Christian Post] about an assault that happened in Portland]]

* [https://www.justice.gov/usao-wdmi/press-release/file/1326161/download Details of the investigation] into the Gov. Whitmer kidnapping plot do not support the argument that it was a plot manufactured by informants
* Tucker has the [https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/08/us/gretchen-whitmer-michigan-militia.html number of people arrested in relation to the kidnapping plot] wrong, because his reporting is just based on a misunderstanding of [https://www.thegatewaypundit.com/2021/07/revealed-fbi-used-least-12-informants-whitmer-kidnapping-case/ a misleading headline from the Gateway Pundit]
* The FBI didn’t “quietly” or “suspiciously” transfer Steven D’Antuono from the Detroit field office to the DC field office. They put out [https://www.fbi.gov/news/pressrel/press-releases/steven-m-dantuono-named-assistant-director-in-charge-of-the-washington-field-office a press release about it]

* Clean coal [https://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/infrastructure/news/a27886/how-does-clean-coal-work/ is not a thing]
* Lots of CO2 is [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5380556/ not good for plants, nor people]
* Alex misreports [https://apnews.com/article/Fact-Check-Fire-Netherlands-Bill-Gates-527107720161 story about a fire in the Netherlands]
* Hadrian Belove [https://www.indiewire.com/2017/08/hadrian-belove-cinefamily-resigns-sexual-harrasment-1201868927/ resigned from Cinefamily after] [https://jezebel.com/after-allegations-of-exploiting-young-women-former-cin-1798320468 sexual harassment allegations], and then Cinefamily [https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-cinefamily-shuts-down-20171114-story.html closed permanently]

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex’s “previously unreleased” interview with Stewart Rhodes, where they discuss whether or not he’s a fed

  • The first Revolver article, and the second, which insinuates/accuses Stewart of being a fed because he had not been arrested at this point

  • Merrick Garland’s speech on the anniversary of January 6, which explains how the investigation has progressed from more straightforward cases to more complex ones

  • Stewart was ambivalent about the Malheur occupation, and also had some issues with credibility after the Bundy Ranch went bad for the Oath Keepers, some of it involving Pete Santilli

  • Stewart’s “operation leader” from January 6 has not been indicted

  • Stewart made multiple calls that went on for at least a minute, which are unlikely to have been attempted calls

  • Ali Alexander got a permit for a rally under false pretenses

  • Stewart lies about almost every aspect of the events of the 6th, according to evidence provided in his indictment. He alleges that his people only went into the capitol to give Ashli Babbitt medical assistance, but they were inside the building before she had even been shot

  • Alex should probably take this video down, or give it a different headline

  • Oath Keeper Jeremy Brown was arrested for his participation in the 6th, and also accidentally posted images indicating his possession of explosives in a Zillow listing when trying to sell his house
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Alex’s “previously unreleased” interview with Stewart Rhodes, where they discuss whether or not he’s a fed
* The [https://archive.is/O3tTN first Revolver article], and [https://americanfaith.com/federal-protection-of-oath-keepers-kingpin-stewart-rhodes-breaks-the-entire-capitol-insurrection-lie-wide-open/ the second], which insinuates/accuses Stewart of being a fed because he had not been arrested at this point
* [https://www.justice.gov/opa/speech/attorney-general-merrick-b-garland-delivers-remarks-first-anniversary-attack-capitol Merrick Garland’s speech] on the anniversary of January 6, which explains how the investigation has progressed from more straightforward cases to more complex ones
* Stewart was [https://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/17/us/standoff-in-oregon-attracts-supporters-bearing-disparate-grievances.html ambivalent about the Malheur occupation], and also [https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/jessicagarrison/stewart-rhodes-oath-keepers-early-history-conflicts had some issues] [https://www.splcenter.org/hatewatch/2017/05/16/leader-josephine-county-oath-keepers-breaks-stewart-rhodes-over-leadership-style with credibility] after the Bundy Ranch went bad for the Oath Keepers, some of it involving Pete Santilli
* [https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2021/07/oath-keepers-january-6-capitol-insurrection-michael-simmons-person-ten/ Stewart’s “operation leader”] [https://extremism.gwu.edu/sites/g/files/zaxdzs2191/f/Caldwell%20et%20al%20Fourth%20Superseding%20Indictment.pdf from January 6] has not been indicted
* Stewart [https://www.justice.gov/opa/press-release/file/1462481/download made multiple calls] that went on for at least a minute, which are unlikely to have been attempted calls
* Ali Alexander got a permit for a rally [https://s3.documentcloud.org/documents/21059849/leopold-capitol-police-protest-permits-january-6-common-law-release.pdf under false pretenses]
* Stewart lies about almost every aspect of the events of the 6th, according to evidence provided in his indictment. He alleges that his people only went into the capitol to give Ashli Babbitt medical assistance, but they were inside the building before she had even been shot
* Alex should probably take this video down, or give it a different headline
* Oath Keeper Jeremy Brown was [https://web.archive.org/web/20211117141721/https://www.thedailybeast.com/alleged-jan-6-rioter-jeremy-brown-tries-to-sell-home-on-Zillow-accidentally-reveals-cache-of-explosives-fbi arrested for his participation in the 6th], and also [https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/21099005-brown-search-warrant accidentally posted images indicating his possession of explosives] in a Zillow listing when trying to sell his house

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex believes that the fact that members of the Bush administration were on Cipro prior to the anthrax letters showing up proves that they had advance knowledge that the letters were coming, and thus a false flag is proven. This is very dumb. There is a vaccine for anthrax, and the reason that the Bush team members were on Cipro was because of fears surrounding the immediate aftermath of 9/11

  • Alex has taken all of his details about the Cipro situation from unfounded allegations from Larry Klayman’s lawsuit alleging advance knowledge on the part of the Bush administration. It’s all baseless and also not true

  • The Houston police department DNA lab was a mess in late 2002. You can find the report of the audit here

  • Alex knows literally nothing about Leo Strauss, even though he is the basis of most of Alex’s conspiracies about neoconservatives being secretly liberals

  • A year old article in the BBC has Alex afraid that the ADL is trying to outlaw the Bible

It’s all baseless and also not true

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex is apparently working with a hypnotist on his new project, Reset Wars

  • Jake has a podcast and YouTube channel that are mostly about how you can make tons of money easily. He also sells a program that claims to be able to “rewire your brain”

  • Jake’s use of a newer translation of Romans, one of very few that includes the word “pattern.” It doesn’t appear in the Greek, and it’s in no translations published before 1976

  • Jake is very big on encouraging people to believe that their physical bodies are just “rental cars,” and that you can’t actually die

  • The MK Ultra experiments were done because of fear that the Soviet Union had already mastered mind control techniques. This is reflected in Congressional hearings about the program, and even some of the earliest documents from the program

  • All of Jake’s information about Dr. Ewen Cameron comes from a CBC article about a podcast about MK Ultra

  • Jolyon West killed an elephant with LSD

  • Ewen Cameron didn’t run MK Ultra, that was Sidney Gottlieb

  • The Mind Has No Firewall article from the US Army War College Quarterly issue from 1998

  • Robert Spalding left the National Security Council because he wrote a memo about wanting to nationalize 5G networks

Also, there are examples of [https://www.courier-journal.com/story/news/local/2018/03/01/marshall-county-high-school-shooter-gabe-parker-courtroom-video/386764002/ white school shooters] [https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/breaking/ct-met-dixon-school-shooting-court-20180518-story.html who have been offered bail]
* Alex lies about the [https://phmpt.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/11/5.3.6-postmarketing-experience.pdf documents released by the FDA] regarding the Pfizer vaccine, specifically about the incidence of reports of spontaneous abortions ([https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/pregnancy-loss-miscarriage/symptoms-causes/syc-20354298 Mayo Clinic information on miscarriages])
* The Japanese Health Ministry does appear to have added [https://freewestmedia.com/2021/12/07/japanese-ministry-of-health-warns-of-serious-side-effects-from-vaccines/ a warning to some vaccines], but it [https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2021/10/14/national/science-health/japan-men-under-30-pfizer-moderna/ doesn’t seem like there’s any indication] that they are considering taking it off the market
* Alex misreports a [https://www.timesofisrael.com/fourth-covid-shot-for-all-israelis-a-possibility-health-minister-says/ story from the Times of Israel] about boosters
* Roger Wicker is the person who suggested a preemptive nuclear strike on Russia was [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-10289031/Wicker-suggests-NUKE-Russia-Ukraine-invasion-claims-table.html on the table]. * [https://www.politifact.com/article/2021/dec/10/fact-checking-glenn-becks-claim-us-government-co-o/ Glenn Beck’s claims] about the cooperation of Moderna and the NIAID [https://factcheck.afp.com/moderna-had-not-developed-covid-19-vaccine-2019 are fallacious]
* Lia Thomas set some records at the recent [https://pennathletics.com/news/2021/12/3/womens-swimming-and-diving-womens-swimming-diving-in-second-place-after-day-one-of-zippy-invitational.aspx Zippy Invitational], but she also came in fourth and fifth in other events

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex’s claim of having predicted the invasion of Ukraine back in fall/winter 2021 is a lie

  • Alex believes that the invasion is the West’s fault, for providing military aid to Ukraine

  • Alex misrepresents comments about NATO possibly invoking Article 5 if Russia does a cyber attack. This is something that has been discussed going back to at least 2019, including in an op-ed written by the Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg

  • Putin’s argument that the West promised Russia to not expand NATO is not totally accurate, and Gorbachev has even said that this was not part of the negotiations that he was literally a part of

  • Alex lies about a new paper about Covid. He’s only read the Daily Mail article about it, and is exaggerating things from there

  • Alex makes up stories about some Chinese media propaganda documents that got leaked. Also, the Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson has an identical position about Putin’s invasion as Alex does
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Alex’s claim of having predicted the invasion of Ukraine back in fall/winter 2021 is a lie
* Alex believes that the invasion is the West’s fault, for providing military aid to Ukraine

This is something that has been discussed [https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-49488614 going back to at least 2019], including in [https://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/world/nato-will-defend-itself-summit-jens-stoltenberg-cyber-security an op-ed written by the Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg]
* [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/02/12/AR2007021200555.html Putin’s argument] that the West promised Russia to not expand NATO is [https://csis-website-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/s3fs-public/legacy_files/files/publication/twq09aprilkramer.pdf not totally accurate], and [https://www.rbth.com/international/2014/10/16/mikhail_gorbachev_i_am_against_all_walls_40673.html Gorbachev has even said] that this was not part of the negotiations that he was literally a part of
* Alex lies about [https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fviro.2022.834808/full a new paper about Covid]. He’s only read [https://weather.com/en-IN/india/coronavirus/news/2022-02-26-new-study-finds-covid-19-dna-linked-to-moderna-patent-filed-in the Daily Mail article] about it, and is exaggerating things from there
* Alex makes up stories about some Chinese media [https://chinadigitaltimes.net/2022/02/minitrue-keep-weibo-posts-on-ukraine-favorable-to-russia-control-comments/ propaganda documents] that got leaked. Also, the [https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2022/feb/23/china-restricts-media-criticism-russia/ Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson has an identical position] about Putin’s invasion as Alex does

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss Alex Jones’ return to the studio after a couple days’ absence.

This episode covers:

  • Alex conflates an AP report with a story from Fox News to claim that the AP was reporting that the coronavirus originated in the Wuhan Institute of Virology lab.

  • Alex attempts to minimize the coronavirus by comparing it to various plagues of the long-distant past.

  • Alex lashes out at vaccines by misrepresenting an interview that Bill Gates recently did with CNBC.

  • Alex discusses his plan to flee Austin to an armored redoubt, which may or may not have something to do with a warning letter he recently received from the FDA.

  • David Knight falsely claims that Harvard professor Charles Lieber was charged with espionage. The DOJ charged him with making false statements.

  • Isaac Ben-Israel’s claims about viruses just lasting 40 days is not a consensus opinion.

Topics covered:

* Alex invites Ann Coulter onto the show in a misguided attempt to humiliate her for her neo-conservatism
* The Project for the New American Century wrote two letters in 1998 about Saddam Hussein, one to [https://web.archive.org/web/20040207055019/http://www.newamericancentury.org/iraqclintonletter.htm President Clinton] and one to the [https://web.archive.org/web/20040221062453/http://www.newamericancentury.org/iraqletter1998.htm GOP leadership]
* Alex weirdly never discusses the [https://www.nsa.gov/portals/75/documents/about/cryptologic-heritage/historical-figures-publications/publications/coldwar/venona_story.pdf Venona] [https://www.nsa.gov/Helpful-Links/NSA-FOIA/Declassification-Transparency-Initiatives/Historical-Releases/Venona/ Intercepts] when talking about the Soviet menace
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20060301083602/https://www.senate.gov/artandhistory/history/common/generic/McCarthy_Transcripts.htm Joseph McCarthy sucked] and [https://web.archive.org/web/20060615173752/http://eisenhowermemorial.org/stories/Ike-Milton-McCarthy.htm got books burned]
* Alex is worried about the creation of a Pan American Union, even though some form of that exact thing has existed [https://www.oas.org/en/about/our_history.asp since 1889]
* The story of re-joining and leaving UNESCO is far more complicated than Alex reports it as. Also, in 2013 the US stopped paying dues [https://news.un.org/en/story/2011/10/393562-unesco-votes-admit-palestine-full-member because UNESCO let Palestine join], and then [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-nation/wp/2017/10/12/u-s-withdraws-from-unesco-the-u-n-s-cultural-organization-citing-anti-israel-bias/ left in 2017], owing over $600 million
* S22 was [https://www.congress.gov/bill/108th-congress/senate-bill/22/text a dead bill] and doesn’t include the things Alex claims
* [https://www.supremecourt.gov/opinions/03pdf/03-6696.pdf Yusef Hamdi] was the American taken to Camp X-Ray
* [https://web.archive.org/web/20050608081331/http://www.prisonplanet.com/articles/july2004/220704gaypornstar.htm Prison Planet article] about porn star at Bohemian Grove. [http://www.voxfux.com/features/bush_child_sex_coverup/WashingtonTimes.htm Washington Times] article. [https://whorulesamerica.ucsc.edu/power/bohemian_grove_spy.html Spy Magazine] piece
* [https://www.cia.gov/library/abbottabad-compound/FC/FC8AEB056C2C32F10AFC327BA91F4A45_The_Bohemian_Grove_and_Other_Retreats.rtf.pdf G. William Domhoff book] that discusses “river jumping”
* Fritz Thyssen’s [http://www.fpp.co.uk/docs/Irving/RadDi/2010/images/Thyssen_lo.pdf letters published in Life]
* Even the ADL [https://www.adl.org/news/article/prescott-bushs-alleged-nazi-ties does not approve] of calling Prescott Bush a nazi

Topics covered:

  • Alex misrepresents a Times of India headline about rates of heart attack among young people

  • Cleveland Clinic article about rising rates of youth heart attacks from 2019, prior to Covid and Covid vaccines

  • Alex reports on a meme about an ad on the side of a bus

  • The ad was paid for by an advocacy group called Achieving Beyond Brain Injury

  • Vascular Health and Risk Management article citing young people as representing 10-15% of stroke patients

  • Alex makes up details about Indian actor Puneeth Rajkumar’s death to try to make it about Covid vaccines

  • Rajkumar’s father, another famous actor, died of a heart attack

  • Alex makes up details about the death of Australian broadcaster Russell Woolf to try to make it about Covid vaccines

Topics covered:

* Alex misrepresents a [https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/goa/docs-reminder-now-nobody-is-too-young-for-a-heart-attack/articleshow/86592692.cms Times of India headline] about rates of heart attack among young people
* [https://health.clevelandclinic.org/why-are-heart-attacks-on-the-rise-in-young-people/ Cleveland Clinic article] about rising rates of youth heart attacks from 2019, prior to Covid and Covid vaccines
* Alex reports on a meme about an ad on the side of a bus
* The ad was paid for by an advocacy group called [https://www.achievingbeyondbraininjury.com/about-us Achieving Beyond Brain Injury]
* [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4348138/ Vascular Health and Risk Management article] citing young people as representing 10-15% of stroke patients
* Alex [https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/sandalwood-star-puneeth-rajkumar-gets-his-first-dose-covid-19-vaccine-146780 makes up details] about Indian actor Puneeth Rajkumar’s death to try to make it about Covid vaccines
* Rajkumar’s father, another famous actor, [https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Kannada-actor-Rajkumar-dies-of-heart-attack/articleshow/1487948.cms died of a heart attack]
* Alex [https://7news.com.au/news/wa/bizarre-claims-made-by-anti-vaxxers-at-rally-held-outside-government-house-on-wednesday-c-4347329 makes up details] about the death of Australian broadcaster Russell Woolf to try to make it about Covid vaccines

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss a couple days on The Alex Jones Show where Alex is trying very hard to demonize the idea of wearing masks to limit the spread of Covid-19.

Topics covered include:

  • Alex has seen some viral videos purporting to show that wearing masks raises CO2 levels you’re breathing to dangerous levels. This has been debunked, and is kind of silly even just at face value. If wearing a mask for a short period of time had any legitimate health risks, there would be many activities that would be nearly impossible, like motorcycle trips or skiing.

  • Alex rewrites the story of the noose that was found at Bubba Wallace’s NASCAR garage in order to turn it into a story of a racism-hoax. His details of the story are inaccurate.

  • Alex hand-waives the rising cases of Covid-19 in the US because there are not also sharply increasing death numbers. This does not take into account that deaths are a lagging indicator when it comes to health emergencies. Typically death numbers do not rise immediately, it takes a while after case numbers rise.

  • Alex says that his enemies need to “go on helicopter rides,” which is a reference to the way Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet would kill his political rivals. Pinochet has become a bit of a hero of the current fascist right-wing, mostly because they know they can’t get away with wearing shirts that say “Hitler Did Nothing Wrong.”

  • Alex thinks that Hillary Clinton and Obama are going to run for president and vice president in the 2020 election. It is too late for them to run within the Democratic party, and it seems entirely unbelievable to think they’d run third party. Alex is kind of just making stuff up.

  • Alex claims that Black Lives Matter wants to destroy the nuclear family. This is just an intentional misrepresentation of their actual position. If you read their statement of beliefs, it’s clear that it’s about viewing each other as family, regardless of blood relation, not about destroying any family structure. They’re also very explicit about respecting parental relations, which upholds familial structures.

  • Alex and his guest, Rev. Childress, discuss how Martin Luther King Jr. was against riots. This is in opposition to one of his most famous quotes, and the later positions he was coming to before his assassination. It’s a longstanding tradition to shame protesters for not being saintly enough to have their concerns heard, and this is just Alex’s racist version of it.

  • Alex and Childress lie about the relationship between Hitler and Planned Parenthood founder Margaret Sanger. Sanger was explicitly anti-Nazi, and Hitler hated Sanger because she worked to increase access to birth control. If all the Aryan women were able to make their own decisions about reproduction, it would hurt the growth of the Third Reich, which was a big concern of his. Sanger and Hitler were not on the same page, regardless of what anti-abortion liars say over and over.

  • Alex pretends that Joe Biden actually said that 120 million people in the US have died from Covid-19, when in reality he had just misspoke. Alex forgot to cut off the part of the clip where Biden begins to correct himself, because he’s terrible at his job.

  • Alex incorrectly reports that the CDC says that masks don’t work at all. He claims that they admit that you wearing a mask will not stop you from spreading the virus, if you’re sick. In reality, the page he’s found on the CDC website is about masks with valves, which most everyday masks do not have. This story is a dud. You can find tons of stories from back in April and May about how masks with valves are not effective at stopping viral transmission.

  • Alex has started a website called We Can’t Breathe, attempting to hijack the police brutality movement and use it against masks. It’s pathetic, racist, and also doesn’t seem to be working. Anyway, cases of Covid-19 in Austin are exploding, so this is a really bad idea.

  • Alex tries to interview his anti-communist hero G. Edward Griffin, but unfortunately Griffin is not really all that into Trump. Because Alex is a coward and can’t argue with someone with as high of stature as Griffin, and because Griffin doesn’t give a shit about Alex’s scam, this leads to Alex suggesting that the Globalists actually wanted Trump to get elected to negotiate a better position with China. He will absolutely forget about this and never bring it up again.

Dan and Jordan discuss a couple days on The Alex Jones Show where Alex is trying very hard to demonize the idea of wearing masks to limit the spread of Covid-19.

Topics covered include:

* Alex has seen some viral videos purporting to show that wearing masks raises CO2 levels you’re breathing to dangerous levels. This [https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/masks-dangerous-health/ has been debunked], and is kind of silly even just at face value. If wearing a mask for a short period of time had any legitimate health risks, there would be many activities that would be nearly impossible, like motorcycle trips or skiing.
* Alex rewrites the story of the noose that was found at Bubba Wallace’s NASCAR garage in order to turn it into a story of a racism-hoax. His details of the story are inaccurate.
* Alex hand-waives the rising cases of Covid-19 in the US because there are not also sharply increasing death numbers. This does not take into account that deaths are a lagging indicator when it comes to health emergencies. Typically death numbers do not rise immediately, it takes a while after case numbers rise.
* Alex says that his enemies need to “go on helicopter rides,” which is a reference to the way Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet would kill his political rivals. Pinochet has become a bit of a hero of the current fascist right-wing, mostly because they know they can’t get away with wearing shirts that say “Hitler Did Nothing Wrong.”
* Alex thinks that Hillary Clinton and Obama are going to run for president and vice president in the 2020 election. It is too late for them to run within the Democratic party, and it seems entirely unbelievable to think they’d run third party. Alex is kind of just making stuff up.
* Alex claims that Black Lives Matter wants to destroy the nuclear family. This is just an intentional misrepresentation of [https://www.mediamatters.org/black-lives-matter/right-wing-media-claim-black-lives-matter-advocates-against-family-through their actual position]. If you read their statement of beliefs, it’s clear that it’s about viewing each other as family, regardless of blood relation, not about destroying any family structure. They’re also very explicit about respecting parental relations, which upholds familial structures.
* Alex and his guest, Rev. Childress, discuss how Martin Luther King Jr. was against riots. This is in opposition to one of [https://time.com/3838515/baltimore-riots-language-unheard-quote/ his most famous quotes], and [https://timeline.com/by-the-end-of-his-life-martin-luther-king-realized-the-validity-of-violence-4de177a8c87b the later positions he was coming to] before his assassination. It’s a longstanding tradition to shame protesters for not being saintly enough to have their concerns heard, and this is just Alex’s racist version of it.
* Alex and Childress lie about the relationship between Hitler and Planned Parenthood founder Margaret Sanger. Sanger was [https://www.nyu.edu/projects/sanger/articles/sanger-hitler_equation.php explicitly anti-Nazi], and Hitler hated Sanger because she worked to increase access to birth control. If all the Aryan women were able to make their own decisions about reproduction, it would hurt the growth of the Third Reich, which was a big concern of his. Sanger and Hitler were not on the same page, regardless of what anti-abortion liars say over and over.
* Alex pretends that Joe Biden actually said that 120 million people in the US have died from Covid-19, when in reality he had just misspoke. Alex forgot to cut off the part of the clip where Biden begins to correct himself, because he’s terrible at his job.
* Alex incorrectly reports that the CDC says that masks don’t work at all. He claims that they admit that you wearing a mask will not stop you from spreading the virus, if you’re sick. In reality, [https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/prevent-getting-sick/cloth-face-cover.html the page he’s found on the CDC website] is about masks with valves, which most everyday masks do not have. This story is a dud. You can find [https://www.insider.com/masks-with-a-breathable-valve-are-useless-experts-warn-2020-5 tons of stories] from [https://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-8266171/Bay-Area-says-masks-valves-not-acceptable-face-protection-amid-coronavirus-pandemic.html back in April] and [https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/05/27/nation/wearing-face-mask-with-valve-it-might-be-time-find-something-else-some-experts-say/ May about how] [https://www.fastcompany.com/90496717/what-is-a-mask-valve-and-why-are-cities-banning-them masks with valves are not effective] at stopping viral transmission.
* Alex has started a website called We Can’t Breathe, attempting to hijack the police brutality movement and use it against masks. It’s pathetic, racist, and also doesn’t seem to be working. Anyway, [https://www.statesman.com/news/20200627/adler-austin-has-nationrsquos-highest-7-day-metro-positivity-rate-of-coronavirus-tests?fbclid=IwAR3eVRaU0q5ar41HreYzSjKRrLTQP_pi8Df5mfqOQUHa_fdp_ssduAK9d5Q&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=web_push cases of Covid-19 in Austin are exploding], so this is a really bad idea.
* Alex tries to interview his anti-communist hero G. Edward Griffin, but unfortunately Griffin is not really all that into Trump. Because Alex is a coward and can’t argue with someone with as high of stature as Griffin, and because Griffin doesn’t give a shit about Alex’s scam, this leads to Alex suggesting that the Globalists actually wanted Trump to get elected to negotiate a better position with China. He will absolutely forget about this and never bring it up again.

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex makes exaggerated claims about influencers being paid to promote vaccines. This has been done, like in Colorado and New Jersey, but it was in the form of a disclosed PSA.

  • There was a strange campaign to pay influencers to spread misinformation about the Pfizer vaccine

  • Alex tries and fails to cover a Brian Stelter video without making personal attacks

  • Conspiracies about Washington state creating internment camps for the unvaccinated are rooted in a statute passed in 2003, which was recently amended to remove stigmatizing language surrounding HIV/AIDS

  • The CDC document Alex believes is a plan to put unvaccinated in camps has nothing to do with that at all

  • Alex believes that a poorly written article on Natural News reflects FEMA documents about their plans to create internment camps for unvaccinated people in rural areas. This article is actually just a reposting of another blog post from a guy named Steve Rotter, who is misrepresenting training provided by the Rural Domestic Preparedness Consortium Organization that long predates Covid

  • Alex is close enough to right about recent Rasmussen polling

  • Alex misreports on an op-ed from a Utah paper

  • All of the documents posted on the Washington legislature’s website say “certified on October 25, 2019” on them

  • Roger Stone had Covid, and is planning to sue everyone

  • Roger’s story about Richard Nixon and Coretta Scott King is possibly inaccurate

  • In 2008, Roger took credit for the Brooks Brothers riot

  • Roger seems to have some racist takes about various Florida congressional hopefuls

  • Mike Lindell is incorrect about alternative voting options in Utah

  • Alex thinks a satirical article about abolishing parenthood is a real article making a sincere argument
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Alex makes exaggerated claims about influencers being paid to promote vaccines. This has been done, like in [https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/21014896-cdphe-vaccine-campaign-comms-plan Colorado] and [https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/13/us/covid-influencer-instagram-tiktok-new-jersey-vaccine-trnd/index.html New Jersey], but it was in the form of a disclosed PSA.
* There was [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/05/26/business/pfizer-vaccine-disinformation-influeners.html a strange campaign] to pay influencers [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/08/11/facebook-russia-disformation-covid-vaccine/ to spread misinformation] about the Pfizer vaccine
* Alex tries and fails to cover a Brian Stelter video without making personal attacks
* Conspiracies about Washington state creating internment camps for the unvaccinated are rooted in [https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx?cite=246-100-040&pdf=true a statute passed in 2003], which was recently [https://www.nbcrightnow.com/news/wa-board-of-health-did-not-enact-covid-internment-camps-or-vaccine-mandate-for-students/article_b986f0ec-740c-11ec-8bf4-dff54e0fb521.html amended to remove stigmatizing language] surrounding HIV/AIDS
* The [https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/global-covid-19/shielding-approach-humanitarian.html CDC document] Alex believes is a plan to put unvaccinated in camps [https://www.factcheck.org/2021/08/scicheck-cdc-document-discusses-strategy-to-protect-displaced-people-from-covid-19/ has nothing to do with that at all]
* Alex believes that a [https://www.naturalnews.com/2021-08-19-fema-documents-isolation-quarantine-round-up-dissenters.html poorly written article on Natural News] reflects FEMA documents about their plans to create internment camps for unvaccinated people in rural areas. This article is actually just a reposting of another [https://steverotter.com/concentration-camps-for-the-unvaccinated/ blog post from a guy named Steve Rotter], who is misrepresenting [https://www.ok.gov/homeland/courses/documents/1505/MGT%20433-PER%20308%20Registration%20Flyer%20-%20Goldsby,%20OK_03-23-16.pdf training] provided by the Rural Domestic Preparedness Consortium Organization that long predates Covid
* Alex is close enough to right about [https://www.rasmussenreports.com/public_content/politics/partner_surveys/jan_2022/crosstabs_heartland_covid_january_5_2022 recent Rasmussen polling]
* Alex misreports on [https://www.sltrib.com/opinion/editorial/2022/01/15/utah-leaders-have/ an op-ed] from a Utah paper
* All of the documents posted on [https://app.leg.wa.gov/WAC/default.aspx the Washington legislature’s website] say “certified on October 25, 2019” on them
* Roger Stone had Covid, and is planning to sue everyone
* Roger’s story about Richard Nixon and Coretta Scott King is [https://ibw21.org/commentary/richard-nixons-secret-visit-with-coretta-scott-king/ possibly inaccurate]
* In 2008, [https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2008/06/02/the-dirty-trickster Roger took credit for the Brooks Brothers riot]
* Roger seems to have some racist takes about various Florida congressional hopefuls
* Mike Lindell is incorrect about [https://www.deseret.com/utah/2020/11/20/21587694/vote-by-cellphone-pilot-legislature-blockchain-voatz-election-security-cryptocurrency-smartphone alternative voting options] in Utah
* Alex thinks [https://www.vcstar.com/story/opinion/columnists/2022/01/13/column-california-should-abolish-parenthood-name-equity/6513756001/ a satirical article about abolishing parenthood] is a real article making a sincere argument

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex tries to one-up himself in terms of bad coverage of Putin’s invasion of Ukraine

  • Alex claims that there are more studies coming out that show Covid was made in a lab, whereas the reality is that studies are coming out showing that it was almost certainly naturally occurring

  • Alex blows up, threatens to leave the show, and goes on to rant about how Russia is the new America

  • Alex decides that he also likes Belarussian dictator Alexander Lukashenko, who sucks

* Alex tries to one-up himself in terms of bad coverage of Putin’s invasion of Ukraine

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss the episode of the Alex Jones Show where Alex discusses his plan to record his final episode in the next week, to be released in the event of his death, or possibly to be released immediately. He’s unclear on the specifics, and he doesn’t follow through anyway.

Topics covered include:

  • Alex lies about an article in the New York Times that he definitely didn’t read. It is about allegations that Chinese agents pushed misinformation, which Alex is pretending is about the entire coronavirus fear being the result of Chinese misinformation. This is a complete misrepresentation of the actual article.

  • Alex claims that Covid-19 related deaths are being massively exaggerated, when all credible sources are suggesting the numbers are likely lower than the reality.

  • Alex doesn’t understand that the Civil War happened before we understood how infectious diseases work, and that there were a bunch of outbreaks during that war that actually prolonged the conflict quite a bit. Also, Alex says that the Civil War was fought “to give black people rights,” which is a direct contradiction of everything else he’s ever said about the Civil War.

  • Alex claims that there were Covid cases in the US in November 2019, when he’s really just misrepresenting the words of Gov. Andrew Cuomo.

  • Alex thinks that Ian Fleming wrote Moonraker to expose the Globalists’ plans to hide out from a chemical weapon release on a space base. Alex doesn’t realize that space was only a part of the movie version of Moonraker, which Fleming didn’t write. The book version is very different, and Alex has no idea what he’s talking about.

  • Alex’s first guest, Shiva Ayydurai, hates Alex’s second guest, Rashid Buttar. Because Alex won’t cancel Buttar, Ayydurai storms off the show, and Alex ends up canceling the interview with Buttar for no reason. It is a real mess.

  • In an attempt to point out how few shark-related deaths there are each year, Alex chooses a random number, and accidentally severely embellishes the problem. He claims there’s 30 a year, when in reality, the average is 4.

  • Alex has decided to champion world hunger because it’s convenient for him to now, though he hasn’t cared much about the issue in the past. He also doesn’t seem to realize that his hero Trump has been making budget cuts to programs that feed starving people in the US, so you can imagine how little Trump cares about hungry people abroad. Alex also doesn’t wrestle with the fact that the people he’s demonized his entire career, the UN, includes people on the forefront of working to solve this problem for as many people as they can. Alex is the villain in his own story.

  • Alex lies about Lady Gaga having to sleep with a personal assistant because she’s afraid of demons.

  • Alex’s story about ancient people being tricked by people who know about eclipses has a deep tradition in 1800’s English literature meant to reinforce white supremacy over the foolish “savages.”

  • Alex lies about a story about coronavirus tests being tainted. There were some contaminated tests, but they weren’t sent to us by China, as Alex asserts. Further, there’s no evidence that these tests ended up infecting anyone.

* Alex doesn’t understand that the Civil War happened [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8513069 before we understood how infectious diseases work], and that there were a bunch of outbreaks during that war that actually prolonged the conflict quite a bit. Also, Alex says that the Civil War was fought “to give black people rights,” which is a direct contradiction of everything else he’s ever said about the Civil War.
* Alex claims that there were Covid cases in the US in November 2019, when he’s really just misrepresenting [https://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2020/04/24/cuomo_the_coronavirus_that_came_to_new_york_did_not_come_from_china_it_came_from_europe.html the words of Gov. Andrew Cuomo].
* Alex thinks that Ian Fleming wrote Moonraker to expose the Globalists’ plans to hide out from a chemical weapon release on a space base. Alex doesn’t realize that space was only a part of the movie version of Moonraker, which Fleming didn’t write. The book version is very different, and Alex has no idea what he’s talking about.
* Alex’s first guest, Shiva Ayydurai, hates Alex’s second guest, Rashid Buttar. Because Alex won’t cancel Buttar, Ayydurai storms off the show, and Alex ends up canceling the interview with Buttar for no reason. It is a real mess.
* In an attempt to point out how few shark-related deaths there are each year, Alex chooses a random number, and accidentally severely embellishes the problem. He claims there’s 30 a year, when in reality, [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/01/21/shark-attacks-were-down-again-2019-only-2-deaths-worldwide/4502604002/ the average is 4].
* Alex has decided to champion world hunger because it’s convenient for him to now, though he hasn’t cared much about the issue in the past. He also doesn’t seem to realize that his hero [https://www.cbpp.org/research/food-assistance/presidents-2021-budget-would-cut-food-assistance-for-millions-and-radically Trump has been making budget cuts to programs that feed starving people in the US], so you can imagine how little Trump cares about hungry people abroad. Alex also doesn’t wrestle with the fact that the people he’s demonized his entire career, the UN, includes people on the forefront of working to solve this problem for as many people as they can. Alex is the villain in his own story.
* Alex lies about [https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-assistant-who-says-lady-gaga-made-her-sleep-in-her-bed-will-get-her-day-in-court-2013-9 Lady Gaga having to sleep with a personal assistant] because she’s afraid of demons.
* Alex’s story about ancient people being tricked by people who know about eclipses has [https://books.google.com/books/about/The_Savage_in_Literature.html?id=E2jADAAAQBAJ a deep tradition in 1800’s English literature] meant to reinforce white supremacy over the foolish “savages.”
* Alex lies about [https://arstechnica.com/science/2020/04/cdcs-failed-coronavirus-tests-were-tainted-with-coronavirus-feds-confirm/ a story about coronavirus tests being tainted]. There were some contaminated tests, but they weren’t sent to us by China, as Alex asserts. Further, there’s no evidence that these tests ended up infecting anyone.

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex believes that all around the world, governments are dropping Covid restrictions because he and his anti-vax friends have mounted too strong an opposition. This is almost entirely based on Boris Johnson’s recent decision to lift Covid restrictions, which is a decision that is being criticized by many UK health organizations, and is very strongly suspected to be a political move meant to appease his party after it came out that he was having parties during the pandemic

  • England is dropping their Covid restrictions, but different plans are in place in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. Ireland is dropping some

  • Canada doesn’t have uniform Covid rules. British Columbia is maintaining their restrictions, as is Quebec, whereas Ontario is easing some up. There is not uniform motion

  • Data is clear that you are more likely to die and more likely to be hospitalized if you have not been vaccinated than if you have. Even data released by Texas reflects this

  • Albania had to postpone impeaching their president because of Covid

  • Albanians are having difficulty entering Kosovo now that they have introduced new Covid restrictions both internally and on the border

  • Belize is now requiring tourists entering the country to purchase travel insurance

  • Germany is tightening their Covid restrictions

  • Italy is adding new businesses to those that require a Green Pass to enter

  • Greece is going to begin issuing fines to unvaccinated people over 60

  • Turkmenistan is ramping up Covid restrictions, including putting medical personnel at road-side checkpoints

  • Alex misrepresents William Shatner’s comments upon returning to Earth

  • The article “Looking Forward To The End Of Humanity” is not about what Alex pretends it is

  • Winter storms are in the forecast, so Alex’s prediction of “cyber attacks” isn’t really that much of a prediction, since power outages count as “cyber attacks” to him

  • Bari Weiss is so on the left that she is trying to start an “anti-Cancel Culture” university

  • Based Stickman got arrested

  • Warnings about Russian troops heading to the border of Ukraine have been on the radar for almost two months now

  • Alex’s story about the 2021 winter storm in Texas is a complete fabrication, particularly the part about the Department of Energy not allowing Texas to increase energy production. The opposite is true

  • The $21.6 million that was being demanded that Luminant pay or else Energy Transfer LP would turn off the flow of gas had nothing to do with federal regulations or government fines. It was a financial dispute between the two companies, and it actually had been resolved two days before Alex recorded this episode
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Alex believes that all around the world, governments are dropping Covid restrictions because he and his anti-vax friends have mounted too strong an opposition. This is almost entirely based on Boris Johnson’s [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/uk-covid-restrictions-cases-boris-johnson-ends-rules-england/ recent decision] to lift Covid restrictions, which is a decision that is being criticized by many [https://www.forbes.com/sites/katherinehignett/2022/01/20/uk-covid-19-health-leaders-urge-caution-as-england-drops-restrictions/?sh=67957d1690f1 UK] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2022/jan/19/sajid-javids-axing-of-all-covid-restrictions-draws-warnings-from-nhs health organizations], and is very strongly suspected to be [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/jan/20/the-guardian-view-on-dropping-covid-restrictions-follow-the-scandal a political move] meant to appease his party after it came out that he was having parties during the pandemic
* England is dropping their Covid restrictions, but [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2022/jan/20/the-guardian-view-on-dropping-covid-restrictions-follow-the-scandal different plans are in place] in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland. Ireland is [https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/ireland-set-rapidly-drop-almost-all-covid-19-restrictions-2022-01-21/ dropping some]
* Canada doesn’t have uniform Covid rules. [https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/covid-19/info/restrictions British Columbia] is [https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2022/01/17/covid-19-restrictions-on-closures-gatherings-to-remain-in-place-in-bc.html maintaining their restrictions], [https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canadas-ontario-start-lifting-covid-related-curbs-quebec-more-cautious-2022-01-20/ as is Quebec, whereas Ontario is easing some up]. There is not uniform motion
* Data is clear that you are [https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#rates-by-vaccine-status more likely to die] and [https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/590748-cdc-unvaccinated-seniors-50-times-more-likely-to-be-hospitalized-than-those more likely] [https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#covidnet-hospitalizations-vaccination to be hospitalized] if you have not been vaccinated than if you have. Even [https://www.khou.com/article/news/health/coronavirus/vaccine/unvaccinated-more-likely-to-die-from-covid-texas/285-2573cd49-e20a-472f-b2cd-ab38129def08 data released by Texas] reflects this
* Albania had to [https://www.euractiv.com/section/politics/short_news/albanian-presidents-impeachment-trial-postponed-over-covid/ postpone impeaching their president] because of Covid
* Albanians are having [https://albaniandailynews.com/news/kosovo-tightens-covid-measures-due-to-grow-of-cases difficulty entering Kosovo] now that they have introduced new Covid restrictions both internally and on the border
* Belize is now requiring tourists entering the country to [https://www.travelandleisure.com/travel-news/belize-to-require-travel-insurance purchase travel insurance]
* Germany is [https://www.dw.com/en/germany-tightens-covid-19-restrictions-on-bars-and-restaurants/a-60355944 tightening their Covid restrictions]
* Italy is [https://www.thelocal.it/20220120/italy-tightens-covid-green-pass-requirements-for-hairdressers-and-shops/ adding new businesses] to those that require a Green Pass to enter
* Greece is going to begin [https://www.schengenvisainfo.com/news/greece-unvaccinated-elderly-to-pay-monthly-fines/ issuing fines to unvaccinated people over 60]
* Turkmenistan is [https://en.turkmen.news/news/turkmenistan-s-commission-to-combat-the-spread-of-disease-steps-up-restrictions-turkmen-news-exclusive/ ramping up Covid restrictions], including putting medical personnel at road-side checkpoints
* Alex misrepresents [https://thehill.com/blogs/in-the-know/in-the-know/576732-shatner-says-he-was-struck-by-fragility-of-this-planet-on-trip William Shatner’s comments] upon returning to Earth
* The article “[https://www.wsj.com/articles/looking-forward-to-the-end-of-humanity-11592625661 Looking Forward To The End Of Humanity]” is not about what Alex pretends it is
* Winter storms are [https://www.foxnews.com/us/winter-storm-southeast-mid-atlantic in the forecast], so Alex’s prediction of “cyber attacks” isn’t really that much of a prediction, since power outages count as “cyber attacks” to him
* Bari Weiss is so on the left that she is trying to start [https://www.vanityfair.com/news/2021/11/bari-weisss-university-hitting-speed-bumps an “anti-Cancel Culture” university]
* [https://www.thedailybeast.com/former-proud-boy-leader-kyle-based-stickman-chapman-arrested-for-attacking-health-care-workers-in-idaho Based Stickman got arrested]
* Warnings about Russian troops heading to the border of Ukraine have been [https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/russia-ukraine-invasion/2021/12/03/98a3760e-546b-11ec-8769-2f4ecdf7a2ad_story.html on the radar for almost two months now]
* Alex’s story about the 2021 winter storm in Texas is a complete fabrication, particularly the part about the Department of Energy not allowing Texas to increase energy production. [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/factcheck/2021/02/23/fact-check-doe-order-let-texas-power-agencies-exceed-emissions-limits/4546085001/ The opposite is true]
* The [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/01/19/texas-pipeline-gas-power-winter/ $21.6 million that was being demanded that Luminant pay or else Energy Transfer LP would turn off the flow of gas] had nothing to do with federal regulations or government fines. It was a financial dispute between the two companies, and it actually had [https://www.texastribune.org/2022/01/20/texas-power-plants-gas-pipeline/ been resolved two days before] Alex recorded this episode

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Alex incorrectly thinks that home-schooled children win all the spelling bees

  • Alex interviews Daniel Lipsman, the father of a whiz kid who was not being awarded a college diploma because she wasn’t old enough to be given a high school equivalence degree

  • Daniel Lipsman was trying to sue the New York School Board, which he had done in 1999 and in 1993, which is too many times for a person to sue a school board

  • Daniel also may have written a book called The Jewish Connection, and he received two write-in votes for a House seat in the 2020 election

  • Alex interview a guy named Dr. David Race Bannon, who claims to be a former assassin working for Interpol to kill human traffickers

  • David Race Bannon entirely made up this story, and he was arrested for criminal impersonation a few years after this interview, and got five years probation

  • Part of the unraveling of Bannon’s backstory was due to a martial arts message board being offended that he lied about his black belt in hapkido

  • It does not appear that New Horizon is an imprint of Penguin Books
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Alex incorrectly thinks that home-schooled children win [https://www.howtohomeschool.com/homeschool-advice/become-a-spelling-bee-champion all the spelling bees]
* Alex interviews Daniel Lipsman, the father of [https://www.bmcc.cuny.edu/news/early-riser/ a whiz kid] who was not being awarded a college diploma because she wasn’t old enough to be given a high school equivalence degree
* Daniel Lipsman was trying to sue the New York School Board, which he had done [https://calculators.law/caselaw/decisions/59nNa7Vj8lJV/lipsman-v-new-york-city-board-of-education in 1999] and [https://www.nytimes.com/1993/09/10/nyregion/day-for-second-guessing-on-asbestos-delay.html in 1993], which is too many times for a person to sue a school board
* Daniel also may have written [https://books.google.com/books?dq=%22Daniel%20Jean%20Lipsman%22&hl=en&id=3T8hAQAAIAAJ&lpg=PA3122&ots=lmf_mFf4Dm&pg=PA3122&sa=X&sig=ACfU3U0B-BRE9q5BPiEwns5ns2xgapOuwQ&source=bl&ved=2ahUKEwjx0LHUg4b2AhWpmOAKHVwKAds4ChDoAXoECB0QAw#v=onepage&q=%22Daniel%20Jean%20Lipsman%22&f=false a book called The Jewish Connection], and he received [https://vote.nyc/sites/default/files/pdf/election_results/2020/20201103General%20Election/00100300013New%20York%20Representative%20in%20Congress%2013th%20Congressional%20District%20Recap.pdf two write-in votes] for a House seat in the 2020 election
* Alex interview a guy named Dr. David Race Bannon, who claims to be a former assassin working for Interpol to kill human traffickers
* David Race Bannon entirely [https://web.archive.org/web/20061014173440/http://www.charlotte.com/mld/charlotte/14897513.htm made up this story], and he was [https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2006/January/06_usncb_049.html arrested for criminal impersonation] a few years after this interview, and got [https://www.denverpost.com/2006/06/29/briefs-630-3/ five years probation]
* Part of the unraveling of Bannon’s backstory was due to [https://web.archive.org/web/20071029061412/http://www.bullshido.net/modules.php?file=viewarticle&id=226&name=Reviews a martial arts message board] being offended that he lied about his black belt in hapkido
* It [http://www.newhorizonpressbooks.com does not appear] that New Horizon is [https://permissions.penguinrandomhouse.com/imprints.php an imprint of Penguin Books]

citations_html:
Topics covered:

  • Strom Thurmond was very racist

  • The Southern Manifesto

  • Strom Thurmond’s party switch, and the larger party swap

  • Alex and John Andrews are mad about Mexican matricula cards, which are IDs issued by the Mexican consulate

  • John Andrews passed legislation in Colorado to limit the forms of ID which public entities could accept as proof of identity. This was supposedly about stopping undocumented immigrants from flouting the law, but it also really hurts citizens, particularly those living in poverty

  • In 2019, John Andrews gave a speech about how the freedom of religion doesn’t apply to Islam

  • The trend of restricting what forms of ID could be accepted by public entities continued and resulted in the Real ID Act

  • Glenn Spencer was an old school self-appointed border guard, and doubtless the inspiration for the people doing it these days, including these two criminals

  • Glenn Spencer is also an antisemite, who cites Kevin MacDonald in his writing

  • The story about gold bars being found in Iraq ended up just being bars of mostly copper from melted down shell casings

  • Alex doesn’t know the difference between JFK’s 1963 commencement speech at American University and his 1961 speech where he used the words “secret societies”

  • JFK’s speech in the UN General Assembly from September 1963

  • The quote where JFK said he was going to destroy the CIA is definitely not solidly sourced and probably isn’t real
citations_mediawiki:
Topics covered:

* Strom Thurmond was very racist
* [https://d1lexza0zk46za.cloudfront.net/history/am-docs/southern-manifesto.pdf The Southern Manifesto]
* [https://www.theitem.com/stories/sen-strom-thurmond-switched-parties-in-64,314269 Strom Thurmond’s party switch], and the [https://www.history.com/news/how-the-party-of-lincoln-won-over-the-once-democratic-south larger party swap]
* Alex and John Andrews are mad about Mexican [https://sgp.fas.org/crs/misc/RL32094.pdf matricula cards], which are IDs issued by the Mexican consulate
* John Andrews [https://leg.colorado.gov/sites/default/files/images/olls/2003a_sl_293.pdf passed legislation] in Colorado to limit the forms of ID which public entities could accept as proof of identity. This was supposedly about stopping undocumented immigrants from flouting the law, but it also [https://web.archive.org/web/20080918025427/http://www.brennancenter.org/page/-/d/download_file_39242.pdf really hurts citizens], particularly those living in poverty
* In 2019, [http://www.backboneamerica.net/america/2019/7/13/know-our-enemy-or-lose-our-liberty John Andrews gave a speech] about how the freedom of religion doesn’t apply to Islam
* The trend of restricting what forms of ID could be accepted by public entities continued and resulted in [https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/PLAW-109publ13/pdf/PLAW-109publ13.pdf the Real ID Act]
* [https://www.splcenter.org/fighting-hate/extremist-files/individual/glenn-spencer Glenn Spencer] was an old school self-appointed border guard, and doubtless the inspiration for the people doing it these days, including these [https://www.justice.gov/usao-nm/pr/larry-mitchell-hopkins-sentenced-21-months-federal-prison-illegal-firearm-possession-new two] [https://www.justice.gov/usao-nm/pr/man-sentenced-21-months-prison-impersonating-border-patrol-agent criminals]
* Glenn Spencer is also [https://web.archive.org/web/20081226015158/americanpatrol.com/SPENCER-GLENN/081223-JewInf-GS_081223.html an antisemite], who [https://www.splcenter.org/fighting-hate/extremist-files/individual/kevin-macdonald cites Kevin MacDonald] in his writing
* The [https://www.stripes.com/news/gold-bars-pique-173rd-s-interest-at-checkpoint-1.5892 story about gold bars] [https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-2003-06-05-0306050213-story.html being found in Iraq] ended up [https://www.nytimes.com/2003/08/02/world/all-bars-that-glitter-in-iraq-are-not-gold.html just being bars of mostly copper] from melted down shell casings
* Alex doesn’t know the difference between JFK’s [https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/A_Strategy_of_Peace 1963 commencement speech at American University] and his [https://www.jfklibrary.org/archives/other-resources/john-f-kennedy-speeches/american-newspaper-publishers-association-19610427 1961 speech] where he used the words “secret societies”
* JFK’s [[-%20https://www.jfklibrary.org/archives/other-resources/john-f-kennedy-speeches/united-nations-19630920|speech in the UN General Assembly]] from September 1963
* The quote where JFK said he was going to destroy the CIA is definitely [https://gizmodo.com/the-story-behind-that-jfk-quote-about-destroying-the-ci-1793151211 not solidly sourced] and probably isn’t real

Dan and Jordan discuss an update to things in the world of Project Camelot. Kerry Cassidy announces that she is going to a subscription model with her videos behind a pay-wall, and thus the show’s coverage of her interviews is likely coming to a close.

For a last right, Dan and Jordan listen to her be interviewed by an Infowars associate named Shepard Ambeliss, which is very dumb.

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss some episodes of The Alex Jones Show where Alex discusses his Fourth of July experiences.

Topics covered include:

  • Alex lies about CNN not covering the stories about the Chinese government’s treatment of the Uyghur people. If you take any time at all to look into it, you’ll find a lot of reporting on CNN about the story, like this, this, this or this.

  • Alex claims his friend Steve Mason warned him about antifa 20 years ago. This is almost certainly bullshit.

  • Roger Stone appears to beg for a pardon, and claims that Bill Clinton was having an affair with Ghislaine Maxwell, whose name he also does not know how to pronounce.

  • Alex claims that on July 4, the planets aligned, which won’t happen again until 2161. It is actually impossible for the planets to physically align, that’s just an expression that is used to describe a situation when planets appear in the same area in the sky. Alex just got this 2161 nonsense from a Facebook meme.

  • Alex claims that crime goes up during full moons. A study from 1984 did find a correlation between crime and the full moon, but subsequent studies have been very mixed in their findings.

  • Alex claims that he inspired the Foo Fighter’s song The Pretender. This seems very unlikely.

  • A caller asks Alex to name the members of the “council of 12” that he’s said run the world. Alex cannot come up with anything better than “there are two Rothschilds' on there.” It’s pathetic.
citations_mediawiki:
Dan and Jordan discuss some episodes of The Alex Jones Show where Alex discusses his Fourth of July experiences.

Topics covered include:

* Alex lies about CNN not covering the stories about the Chinese government’s treatment of the Uyghur people. If you take any time at all to look into it, you’ll find a lot of reporting on CNN about the story, like [https://www.cnn.com/interactive/2020/02/asia/xinjiang-china-karakax-document-intl-hnk/ this], [https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/19/asia/xinjiang-explainer-intl-hnk-scli/index.html this], [https://www.cnn.com/2019/01/18/asia/uyghur-china-detention-center-intl/index.html this] or [https://www.cnn.com/2018/02/02/asia/china-xinjiang-detention-camps-intl/index.html this].
* Alex claims his friend Steve Mason warned him about antifa 20 years ago. This is almost certainly bullshit.
* Roger Stone appears to beg for a pardon, and claims that Bill Clinton was having an affair with Ghislaine Maxwell, whose name he also does not know how to pronounce.
* Alex claims that on July 4, the planets aligned, which won’t happen again until 2161. It is actually impossible for the planets to physically align, that’s just an expression that is used to describe a situation when planets appear in the same area in the sky. Alex just got this 2161 nonsense from a Facebook meme.
* Alex claims that crime goes up during full moons. [https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1444800/?page=1 A study from 1984] did find a correlation between crime and the full moon, but subsequent studies have been very mixed in their findings.
* Alex claims that he inspired the Foo Fighter’s song The Pretender. This seems very unlikely.
* A caller asks Alex to name the members of the “council of 12” that he’s said run the world. Alex cannot come up with anything better than “there are two Rothschilds' on there.” It’s pathetic.

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan discuss Alex Jones’ growing insistence that Trump declare war on China, and how the media played directly into Alex’s hands with the “eating his neighbors” thing.

Topics covered include:

  • Alex doesn’t understand the difference between lifespan and life-expectancy. He also seems to think that people only lived to 30 back in the 1930’s, which is not true.

  • Alex pretends that his outburst about eating his neighbors was satire, not recognizing that satire requires a point. The most generous description of what he was doing is trolling, and honestly, it’s most likely it was an outburst that he’s turned into a PR opportunity.

  • Alex and Owen discuss the doctors in CA who say the virus is all overblown, who have been widely discredited.

  • Alex pretends that a Facebook post by Jair Bolsonaro revealed real information that the WHO recommends doctors masturbate infants. It’s all nonsense, to the point where Bolsonaro even deleted the post.

  • Leo Zagami shows up to talk to Alex about how these are the end times, and how in 2025 the saints will return and the inevitable Armageddon will be upon us. Leo has also declared himself Jesus, took credit for 9/11, and was big into 2012 conspiracies, so take his predictions with a grain of salt.

  • Leo shows his racism by calling Mark Zuckerberg’s wife Priscilla Chan, who was born in Massachusetts, “a Chinese.”

citations_html:
Dan and Jordan explore Alex Jones’ latest visit to Joe Rogan’s podcast, where all sorts of bullshit got discussed.

Topics covered include:

  • Jim McKelvey, co-founder of Square, which owns Cash App, is a board member of the St. Louis Federal Reserve Bank.

  • Discussion of the death of Robert Maxwell.

  • Michael Pakenham’s review of the book about Robert Maxwell being a spy.

  • A breakdown of the events in the McMartin Preschool trial

  • Further discussion of the McMartin trial

  • 1990 LA Times article about the political background of the McMartin prosecution

  • Ted Gunderson lived with one of the parents of a McMartin student who was involved with the project to dig up the alleged tunnels

  • The archaeological report on the McMartin tunnels is questionable

  • ProPublica article about the 281 lobbyists who Trump has hired

  • Politico article about the 82 former Trump administration members who went on to be lobbyists

  • Reuters article about ATT&T’s payments to Michael Cohen

  • There were articles about the recent peace deals

  • Jared Kushner’s dad pled guilty to trying to blackmail his sister’s husband, who was a collaborating witness against him

  • The magical Utah coal mine doesn’t seem to be in the USGS report

  • Utah produces 2% of the US’s annual coal

  • Clean coal doesn’t mean what Alex thinks it does

  • The idea that hurricanes are getting worse is not “media hype”

  • Alex is making things up about the Club of Rome’s Limitations of Growth document

  • The FBI’s Finders files

  • More information about the lawsuit filed by Geronimo’s great-grandson

  • AP article about the search for William Colby’s body

  • Medical Examiner’s report about William Colby

  • The Rockefeller document that Alex’s conspiracy is not based on

  • The Rockefeller document that Alex’s Lock Step conspiracy is based on

  • An explanation of what vaccine-derived polio actually is
